Este banco está conformado por 07 mujeres y 05 varones, quienes se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, está zona posee un clima cálido y fértil; en la que se cultiva entre los productos de maíz, papa, hortalizas, y otros, diversidad de frutas, las socias del banco invertirán el préstamo otorgado en la compra de fertilizantes y compra de productos como las semillas para la nueva temporada de sembrío, previo al trabajo de tierras para poder ser cultivadas nuevamente; muchas de ellas son también comerciantes, llevan sus verduras y frutas a diferentes lugares de la región, también elaboran riquísimas mermeladas de pulpa de frutas, sin utilizar conservantes, son productos 100% naturales.

Las socias valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado, ya que en estás zonas rurales, no se adquiere a la banca financiera de forma menos compleja; por lo tanto ellos se comprometen  a la devolución del mismo en el plazo estipulado y reiteran su apoyo a estos socios con deseos de superación.
texts.en:
This small bank is called "Santa Catalina de Sillacancha" after one of the patron saints of the community of Sillacancha in the village of Calca, Cusco province, located 1 hour and 30 minutes from the city of Cusco. This community is in the sacred valley of the Inkas. This bank is made up of seven women and five men who are mainly farmers. This area has a hot climate and is fertile, where the main crops are corn, potato, vegetables and such, as well as a variety of fruit. The members of the bank will invest the loan in the purchase of fertilizers and products such as seeds for the new sowing season, before working the soil so the fields can be resown. Many of them are also merchants: they bring their fruits and vegetables to different places in the region as well as making delicious marmelades from their fruit, without the use of preservatives. They make 100% natural products. The members value and are grateful for the loan: because they are in the countryside they do not have access to traditional banks. They are committed to repaying the loan on schedule and have pledged their support to the members who want to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, products, to make marmelades.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes N. is a typical grocery retailer in their place at Laligan, Valencia City, Southern Philippines. She has applied for a 4th loan amounting to Php 14,000 to purchase additional stocks of grocery items. She started this project last year, utilizing the vegetables harvested from their garden until she could purchase other items which were frequently requested by her local customers. Someday she dreams of having her own storehouse where she could keep palay (newly harvested rice grains).

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery stocks for sale

loans.name: Odontuya

texts.en:
Odontuya S. is 39, married and has one daughter. Her family lives in a "ger" (a nomadic Mongolian tent) district in Henti, the Mongolian province of Chinggis (Genghis) Khan's birthplace. 

Her husband, Erdenebayar, is a taxi driver. Her only daughter, DolgorS., is a 19-year-old university student. Since 2003, Odontuya has been running a clothing retail business at the local market. She goes to Ereen, a Chinese border city where many Mongolians buy cheap goods for their businesses, a few times a year. 

When she first started her business, her working capital was around 500,000 MNT. From profits, she has bought a house and a car for her husband's taxi service. As a result of her hard work, Odontuya's business inventory has increased to 1,200,000 MNT. 

Odontuya is a loyal and hard-working person. She is one of many repeat XacBank borrowers. With this loan, she will buy adult clothing apparel from Ereen, China.

loans.use: To buy adult clothing apparel from Ereen, China.

loans.name: Maria Lina

texts.en:
Maria Lina C. is a pig grower. She is 44 and has two children. She was not content to just sit in the house. She wanted to help her husband, Nestor C., by earning money and contributing to the family income. Now she has five pigs and one sow. She sells the pigs for Php 8,000 to Php 9,000 each. This has been her business for the past five years.

The purpose of her loan is to buy additional piglets and pig feed. The loan will help her grow the size of her piggery and earn a bigger income in the future.

Maria Lina C. enjoys the services that CEVI offers. CEVI provides not just loans but also training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi N. is a 55-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of seven children who are independent except the last born who is currently pursuing education at the junior high school level. Esi presently lives with her husband and her last child at Mankessim, the town where she also does her trade. She trades in vegetables and spices like onions, tomatoes, pepper, garden eggs, green pepper etc. She sells on top of table in the community market of Mankessim.  Esi treks to a nearby city, Kumasi to buy vegetables and spices and retail. Complaining of small working capital, she believes the loan would enable her to purchase stock in bulk per trip and increase her profit margin eventually. Still responsible for the education of her last born, she hopes that she would be able to improve her savings to support her child to enter senior high school next year. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and spices in bulk.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia M., a 44-year-old married mother of two school-aged children from the city of Dipolog, owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products, including plastic wares, in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell, Lilia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP for the same purpose. This will be her third loan taken from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en: Abibatu sells foodstuffs in her shop. She is 45 years old and married with five children. She hopes for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор Туйматова  проживает вместе со своей матерью и сестрой в Зафарабадском районе Согдийской области. Отец Гулбахор недавно ушел из жизни, поэтому ей, как старшей дочери семьи приходится ухаживать за матерью и содержать семью. Гулбахор еще не замужем. У нее есть точка продаж, на рынке «Бадахшан», где она торгует продуктовыми товарами. В ассортимент ее товара входят различного рода сладости, напитки и сухофрукты. В бизнесе ей помогает сестра. Гулбахор хочет получить кредит в размере 4000 сомони, для того чтобы увеличить колличество своего товара и расширить бизнес.
texts.en:
Gulbahor T. lives with her mother and sister in the Zafarabad district of Sogd region. Gulbahor's father recently passed away, so as the oldest daughter, she now cares for her mother and supports the family. Gulbahor is not married. She has a small shop at the Badakhshan market where she sells grocery items, such as sweets, drinks, and dried fruits. Her sister helps her with the business. Gulbahor is requesting a loan of 4000 somoni to supplement her inventory and expand the business.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her grocery business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and resell pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina is a member of the kwamambo North,In Kinyanambo,Iringa,she is 24 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is aged 10 month`s,she also cares for other 3 dependents.

Evelina started her own shop business 2 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is evelina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more soap,sugar,wheat.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Evelina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more soda,sugar,soap

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es socia del Banco Comunal Desarrollo.
Norma es casada, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Norma junto a su esposo tienen una panadería, donde elaboran panes típicos, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de personal, sus ventas los realiza en las agencias interprovinciales. Además Norma vende condimentos secos en el mercado Covadonga.
Norma necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina y ají panca.
Los sueños de Norma son construir mas pisos en su casa, sus hijos sean profesionales y ser una empresaria de éxito.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Development Communal Bank. She is married, is 30 years old and has 3 children. Norma and her husband have a bakery where they make typical breads and which she has staff for. She makes her sales at interprovincial agencies. In addition, Norma sells dried seasonings in the Covadonga market. Norma needs a loan of 3000 soles which she will invest in flour and Peruvian red peppers. Norma's dreams are to add more stories to her house, for her children to become working professionals, and to be a successful businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour and Peruvian red pepper

loans.name: Memunatu K.

texts.en:
This is Memunatu K. D., age forty-two. Memunatu was born in Freetown. She currently resides in Waterloo where she is married and runs her business. Her husband is a monthly wage earner. They have two children – one in Junior Secondary School III and the other in class II.  Memunatu is a dealer in cosmetics and boutique stocks – she sells clothes, trinkets, shoes, bags, body beauty creams etc. She has been in business for over twenty years now. This will be her very first loan from SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone in Waterloo. She is requesting a loan of Le 4,000,000 to help her strengthen her business.

With this loan she receives from SMT/Kiva, Memunatu is expecting a vast improvement in her business and increased profit. The increased profit will be reinvested into the business, some will be saved for future use and the remainder will be used to support her husband in providing food for their household and paying school fees and other school related charges for the children and meeting other daily financial challenges.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Rosa Lucrecia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Ensueños se encuentra en la vecina ciudad de Azogues a unos 30 minutos de Cuenca, esta ciudad tiene clima frío, se caracteriza por sus iglesias y por la belleza que ésta encierra, su centro se mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente es muy amable y luchadora  buscando siempre la superación personal y familiar. 

La señora Rosa Lucrecia González es una de las socias activas del banco comunal Ensueños, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Azogues, tiene 37 años y se encuentra casada, concibió dos hijos, 16 y12 años de edad que estudian en el colegio la Salle, su esposo emigro al extranjero hace varios años en busca de un mejor futuro para su familia;  aún no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Rosa trabaja como empleada de un gabinete de belleza hace unos tres años, su horario de trabajo es de 8 a 12 a.m. y de 2 a 6 p.m. de lunes a sábado, también se encuentra comenzando su propio negocio de venta de cosméticos con  los productos de L´bel (cosméticos para la belleza de la mujer), lleva 7 meses en este negocio y nos comenta que le va muy bien porque en su trabajo está  obteniendo su  clientela.

Dentro de su banco Rosa es muy amable y se lleva muy bien con todas las socias, este es  su quinto ciclo trabajando con los prestamos que la fundación ofrece, además le  han permitido estabilizarse económicamente y con el préstamo que ESPOIR le entregue va a invertir en la compra de más productos de belleza para ofrecer un stock variado a sus clientas.

Su mayor sueño es viajar con su esposo y sus hijos por todo el mundo.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal Ensueños is located in Azogues, neighboring city to Cuenca, which is located some 30 minutes away. The city’s climate is cold and is characterized by its churches and by the beauty that surrounds it. Its city center is a mix of colonial and modern, and its people are amiable and hardworking, always striving for personal and familial growth. Mrs Rosa Lucrecia Gonzáles is an active member of the Banco Comunal Ensueños. She lives in the center of Azogues, is 37 years old, and is married, with two sons ages 16 and 12. Her sons attend El Colegio La Salle. Her husband emigrated abroad in search of a better future for the family. They do not have a home of their own yet, which is why they rent. Rosa has been working at a beauty salon for the past 3 years, from 8:00 am to noon and from 2:00 pm to 6:00 pm Monday through Saturday. She is also in the process of starting her own business selling cosmetics from the L’Bel brand (beauty products for women). She’s been working at this for 7 months and says it’s going well because her job helps build up her clientele. At the Banco, Rosa is very amiable and gets along well with the other members. This is her fifth lending cycle. The loans have helped her establish herself financially, and with this current loan from ESPOIR she will invest in the purchase of more beauty products so she may offer a better variety to her clients. Her biggest dream is to travel the world with her husband and sons.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase L´bel beauty products for women

loans.name: Edmonde

texts.fr: K. Edmonde est née en 1974 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative du Bénin. Edmonde est mariée à ANASSOU Hounhoui. Edmonde et Hounhoui ont six enfants tous scolarisés dont quatre sont encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Avakpa à Porto-Novo. Edmonde vend des divers (pâtes alimentaires ; biscuits ; boîtes de sucres, de lait, de tomate, de sardines ; des savons ; des papiers hygiéniques, etc.) et du gasoil. C’est Ikpinlè à la frontière bénino-nigériane que Edmonde s’approvisionne en gasoil. Edmonde est à son troisième crédit avec ALIDé. Edmonde a bien remboursé ses crédits et sollicite un autre pour élever le niveau de son activité.
texts.en:
K. Edmonde was born in 1974 in Porto-Novo, Administrative Capital of Bénin. Edmonde is married to ANASSOU Hounhoui. Edmonde and Hounhoui have six children, all enrolled in school, four of whom are still their responsibility. The family lives in Avakpa in Porto-Novo. Edmonde sells various items (pasta, cookies, tins of sugar, milk, tomatoes, sardines; soap, toilet paper, etc.) and diesel fuel. She gets her diesel fuel at Ikpinlè on the Benin-Nigeria border.

Edmonde is on her third loan with ALIDé. She reimbursed her previous loans in a timely manner and is requesting another to bolster her little business. .

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of diesel and various items for resale

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is part of a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Cruz Pata, a town located 45 minutes from Cusco.  The group is called Sacro.  He lives in Cruz Pata.  He is 39 years old and is married.

Francisco has a transport business and drives a taxi.  With this loan, he will maintain his vehicle.

Francisco appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Hoàng Thị's Group

texts.en:
H. Hoàng Thị (10107070049) is a 46-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà nội. H. is the group leader of a six-member group requesting a loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Xuân Trạch 07 (6).

H. is married and has three grown children. To making a living, H. operates a family member's business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale. H. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2006, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,578,000 VND from SEDA, which was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,322,000 VND, which will also be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. This loan will be the fifth loan she has taken out from SEDA. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:
1. PH.m Thị B. (10107070047) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 3,270,000 VND loan to support her business operating a butcher shop.

2. Vũ Thị L. (10107070051) is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 5,450,000 VND loan to support her business providing recycling services.

3. Nguyễn Thị Hạ (10107070048) is a 41-year-old female who is requesting a 5,450,000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall.

4. Đào Thị T. (10107070050) is a 46-year-old female who is requesting a 5,450,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

5. Bùi Thị C. (10107070063) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 4,142,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

H. Hoàng Thị (10107070049) là 46 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội. H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ H.n hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Xuân Trạch 07 (6).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán. H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND. Vào 2006, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. H. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.578.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.322.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. PH.m Thị B. (10107070047) là 38 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.270.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng thịt.

2. Vũ Thị L. (10107070051) là 29 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.450.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế.

3. Nguyễn Thị Hạ (10107070048) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.450.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

4. Đào Thị T. (10107070050) là 46 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.450.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

5. Bùi Thị C. (10107070063) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.142.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, es una cliente desde el año 2004, ella comenzo con el grupo solidario Buen Samaritano, y luego con el grupo Diamante en doce secuencias, posteriormente se individualizo; siendo  este credito su tercera secuencia con este crédito individual, es una cliente muy trabajadora, ya que antes de fallecer su esposo, ella se dedicaba a la mantención de su hogar y la educación de sus dos hijos, ellos son menores de edad que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella con los créditos que sacó se fue comprando bienes para su hogar,y para el negocio, vive en la casa de su mamá, tiene buenas referencias de los vecinos, es una buena cliente.
texts.en:
Sonia has been a borrower since 2004. She began as part of the Buen Samaritano group and later with the Diamante group for twelve cycles. She is now taking out loans individually. This is her third individual loan. She is a very hard worker, since before her husband passed away she was in charge of maintaining the household and educating her two children, who are still young and who attend school. With the previous loans she took out, she purchased goods for her house and for her business. She lives in her mother's house, has good references from neighbors, and is a good borrower.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Ana Delmy

texts.es: Ana Delmy R. C. de 33 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Miguel, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 7 y 2 años de edad. Ella posee una venta de pollo en el mercado Municipal del Transito, en el cual hace más de cinco años trabaja vendiendo su producto. Ella desea poder comprar mayor cantidad de pollos sobre todo para esta temporada navideña en la cual las personas utilizan el pollo para las cenas navideñas. Es por esta razón que ana Delmy solicita un préstamo a  través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar más pollo. Milagro es una mujer muy responsable la cual desea el bienestar de su familia y es por esto que se esfuerza día con día.
texts.en:
Ana Delmy R. C., age 33, resides in the department of San Miguel and lives with her husband and two children, ages 7 and 2. She owns a stall selling poultry in the market in the municipal bus terminal, where she has been working for more than 5 years. She wishes to buy a greater quantity of chicken, especially for the Christmas season when people buy more chicken for Christmas dinner. For this reason Ana Delmy is requesting a loan which will provide her sufficient capital to buy more poultry. She is a very responsible woman who wants to provide for the well being of her family and that's why she works hard day after day.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicken.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene D. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin province. She is 33 years old, is widowed and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Irene owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Irene is just starting this business.

In 2009, Irene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irene is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan which Irene has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer de 34 años, muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive sola en la casa que le cedieron sus padres, no está casada y lo que más desea es vivir un futuro tranquilo.
El negocio de la sastrería es una actividad que le viene de familia, ya que aprendió este arte de su padre cuando todavía era muy joven. Su negocio es muy concurrido y sus clientes hacen cola para que les realice la confección de alguna prenda.
Pero a pesar que tiene muchos clientes ella trabaja sola, ya que sus ingresos económicos todavía no le permiten contratar a un ayudante con quien pueda acelerar la confección de los pedidos.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es realizar el acabado a sus prendas, lleva 20 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su sastrería. 
Con el tiempo, anhela que su negocio crezca y que se convierta en uno de los talleres de confección más reconocidos de la ciudad de Juliaca.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Julia con MFP y está dispuesta a pagarlo puntualmente, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde participa activamente. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprara nuevos materiales para la confección de sus prendas.
texts.en:
Julia is a 34 year-old woman, very unassuming and hardworking. She lives alone in a house that her parents gave her. She is not married and she wishes most to lead a peaceful life. The tailor’s trade is an activity that comes to her through family, since she learned the art from her father when she was still very young. Her business is very popular and her clients line up so that she can tailor their garments. Even though she has many clients, she works alone since her income will not permit her to hire an assistant to help her speed up the preparation of her orders. On the other hand, the thing she likes most about her work is finishing the garment. She has spent 20 years tailoring and considers the most difficult part is to have to stay in her shop all day. Julia longs for her business to grow with time, and for it to become one of the most recognized tailoring shops in the city of Juliaca. This is the sixth loan that Julia has had with MFP and she has already arranged to make prompt payments as she has no wish to cause problems for her partners at the community bank where she participates actively. With the 2,000 nuevos soles (PEN) she is asking for, she would buy new materials to make her garments.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick Clarke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy textile materials

loans.name: W.

texts.en: R. is a 44 year old woman. She is married and living with her husband; they do not have any children. She is currently running a mushroom business, in which she grows mushrooms that she sells to the market and her nearest neighbours. Her husband has a small retail business selling electric bulbs, and he also helps her to sell the mushrooms at the market. She wants to increase her business as her husband’s income alone isn't enough for the two of them.

loans.use: Inputs for growing mushrooms and plastic packaging

loans.name: Keoun

texts.en: N. Keoun, age 27, is a farmer who lives with her husband and two young children in Takeo Province. N. Keoun and her husband sell coconuts. She typically makes about US $1.00 each day and her husband, Oun Eng, makes about US $5.00 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, N. Keoun included. N. Keoun would like a loan of US $400 to purchase a trailer to transport more coconuts to the local market to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for her business

loans.name: Poch's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Poch S. is 37 years old and the leader of a 4-member group loan offered by AMK, located in Chey Chumneah village in Kandal province. Mrs. Poch S. is a grocery seller who owns a small store to resell the groceries (white sugars, peppers, mono sodium glutamate, garlic, and so on). Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to re-sell. With this business, she hopes to increase her income to improve the family's living situation. Her husband, Mr. Pou Hai, is a police officer who receives a small salary to support his family. This couple has six children, one of whom is staying at home, while another four are students in the local school, and the youngest one is 2 years old.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Juana Margarita

texts.es:
Juana Margarita López Rodríguez, quien  Labora como Conserje en el Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería, ella tiene un hijo a su cargo,  y  este se encuentra en edad escolar, es casada, ha trabajado cuatro crédito con CEPRODEL durante cuatro años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por  CEPRDEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de materiales de  construcción como: zinc, perlines, clavos y mano de obra para el techo de su casa de de habitación. 
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juana Margarita López Rodríguez works as a custodian at the National Engineering University (Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería). She is married and has school-age son. Juana Margarita has already had four loans with CEPRODEL within the last four years. During this time, she has invested the loans into making improvements in her home. She was able to do this thanks to the financing provided by CEPRODEL. The loan is she is requesting is for the purchase of construction materials such as zinc, roofing beams, and nails as well as to pay for the labor costs; these materials will be used for making improvements to the roof of her house. Juana Margarita wants to do all this in order to create a better and safer environment for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements and expansion

loans.name: Soraida Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Zoraida de edad de 38 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y esforzada al trabajo, desde hace varios años tiene una pulpería que logro iniciar con ayuda de su esposo económica, pues tiene una camioneta en el cual la trabaja para hacer acarreo. Procreo cuatro hijos de los cuales tres estudian y ayudan en casa, el mayor trabaja. Cuando inicio su pequeño negocio lo hizo con pocos productos vendiendo leña, frutas y verduras. Con las ganancias de la venta, logran la alimentación, gastos básicos, en todo este tiempo no le ha alcanzado para hacer las mejoras a su pequeña casa que aun es forrada con madera y de tierra lo que quisiera mejorar para el bienestar de sus hijos. Con este crédito podrá comprar materiales de construcción como piedra, arena, cemento para quitar madera y cerrar toda de concreto para mejor seguridad. Contenta por que se ha beneficiado con estos préstamos que invertidos en su casa y en su venta.
texts.en:
Dona Zoraida, 38, is a hard-working woman. She has operated a small general store for several years, a business that she started with help from her husband who has a truck that he uses to make deliveries for the store. The couple has four children, three of whom are in school and able to help around the house. The oldest works. She started the business with only a handful of products, selling firewood, fruits and vegetables. With her earnings, she was able to buy food and everyday supplies but the money never stretched far enough to make improvements to her little house, a house built from wood and earth that Zoraida would like to improve for the well-being of her children. She will use this loan to buy construction materials--stone, sand, cement--so that she can remove the wood and enclose the entire structure in concrete, something that will better secure the house. She is happy to have received this loan and past ones because they have helped her to improve both her house and her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for home improvement project.

loans.name: Randy

texts.en:
Randy M. is from the village of Agunod Plaridel Misamis Occidental. He is 38 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, he owns a store selling daily use products such as biscuits, candies, shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Randy has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Randy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Randy from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Our Father #3 Group

texts.en:
Fanta T. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Our Father #3.  She is 35 years old, married and has seven children who range from 3 to 18 years old.  She was not able to attend school due to poverty.


For 13 years, she has been selling used clothes at the River View Market in Gardnersville, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.  She sells in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning.  


She  plans to use her LRD 6,000 portion of this LRD 30,000 group loan to buy more used clothes. Her goal is to grow her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.


In the photo that accompanies this profile, Fanta is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes.

loans.name: El Limon Flat Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA EL LIMON YA QUE FUE EL PRIMER NOMBRE QUE SALIO PARA QUE SE LLAMARA SU GRUPO, LAS CUATRO INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON FRANCISCA S., REFUGIO C., JUANA G. Y MA ESPERANZA C. ELLAS SE DEDICAN: FRANCISCA  ALA VENTA DE ZAPATOS POR MENUDEO, REFUGIO ELABORA CUEDROS PARA VENDER, JUANA VENDE BUÑUELOS,DONAS EN LAS NOCHES Y MA ESPERANZA QUIERE VENDER COMIDA LOS FINES DE SEMANA.

LA SRA FRANCISCA S. ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO ELLA ES CASADA TIENE TRES HIJOS DE 20, 17 Y 12 AÑOS DE EDAD FRANCISCA QUIERE DEDICARSE A SU NEGOCIO YA QUE ASI PUEDE AYUDAR A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS DE LA CASA ELLA ESTA SEGURA DE QUE LA VENTA DE ZAPATOS Y HUARACHES ES UN BUEN NEGOCIO YA QUE SE IRA A VENDER A LAS PLAZAS DE LOS PUEBLOS ALEDAÑOS DE SU COMUNIDAD YA QUE VA GENTE DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y NO LE GUSTA DAR CARO.

CON ESTE CREDITO VA A COMPRAR HUARACHES DE LEON GUANAJUATO, ZAPATOS, BOTAS, CHANCLAS, ETC. SU META PARA UN FUTURO ES TENER UN GRAN NEGOCIO Y TENER MUCHOS CLIENTES PARA ASI UN DIA PODER SACAR A SUS HIJOS ADELANTE Y PODERLES DAR UNA CARRERA.

DOÑA FRANCISCA NOS COMENTA QUE ELLA SE SIENTE MUY AFORTUNADA DE QUE LE HAYAN PODIDO DAR EL CREDITO YA QUE DESDE CUANDO TENIA MUCHAS GANAS DE ENTRAR A ESTA FINANCIERA YA QUE LE HABIAN COMENTADO DE SU INTERES BAJO Y LA SERIEDAD CON LA QUE TRABAJAN Y AHORA QUE SE ESTAN UNIENDO CON UNA NUEVA EMPRESA ESPERAN QUE LAS SIGAN APOYANDO Y POR PARTE DE ELLAS ASEGURAN QUE NO VAN A QUEDAR MAL.

POR ULTIMO AGRADECE A KIVA Y FUNDACION REALIDAD POR AYUDARLAS PARA SACAR SUS NEGOCIOS ADELANTE.
texts.en:
This group is called “El Limon” (The Lime) since that was the first name they thought of to call themselves. The four members of the group are Francisca S., Refugio C., Juana G., and Ma Esperanza C.. Their business activities are as follows: Francisca sells shoes at retail; Refugio creates paintings to sell; Juana sells fritters and donuts in the evenings; and Ma Esperanza wants to sell food on the weekends.

Sra. Francisca S. is a member of the group. She is married and has three children (ages 20, 17, and 12). Francisca wants to concentrate on her business so that she can help her husband with the household expenses. She is confident that selling shoes and sandals is a good business and plans to offer her products in the main squares of the surrounding villages in her community. The people who live there have limited resources, so she does not want to sell anything expensive.

Francisca will use her loan to buy sandals, shoes, boots, flip-flops, and other items in Leon Guanajuato. Her goal for the future is to have a great business and many customers so that one day her children can get ahead and earn a degree.

Doña Francisca says she feels very fortunate to have been granted a loan. She wanted to pursue financing due to the low interest and because she is serious about her business. Now that she is part of a new group of ladies, she hopes that they will continue receiving support and work together so that they do not fail.

Finally, she thanks Kiva and Fundación Realidad for helping them move their businesses forward.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sandals, shoes, boots, flip-flops, and other types of footwear

loans.name: Shishikara Group

texts.fr:
Esperate N. est une commerçante âgée de 25ans qui habite la Commune de Kanyosha en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle fait le commerce de charbon et de la Biere industrielle alcoolisée au quartier Kanyosha à Bujumbura. C’est un métier qu’elle exerce depuis 3ans juste a sa sortie de l’école ou elle a obtenu le Diplôme A4 en études professionnelles. Son époux, Etienne Habonimana, est lui aussi un commerçant. Elle est maintenant  au 6e cycle dans le crédit communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle est mère de 2 enfants âgés respectivement de 3 ans et 1 année 6mois. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour diversifier son business avec les produits vivriers comme la farine de manioc, l’huile de palme,mais aussi augmenter la quantité des produits habituels  qu’elle revend aux clients. Elle espère ainsi que cela lui permettra d’acquérir une plus grande capacité de générer du bénéfice et ainsi avoir son propre capital pour devenir une commerçante grossiste dans l’avenir. Elle va continuer à demander le crédit Turame  car les conditions d’accès sont plus souples par rapport aux autres institutions financières.

 Elle est une des membres du groupe  communautaire « Shishikara ».
texts.en:
Esperate N. is a 25-year-old merchant living in the Kanyosha borough of the Bujumbura mayorship, where she sells coal and commercial beer. She has been leading this activity ever since graduating from school with an A4 professional degree. Her husband Etienne Habonimana is also a merchant. She is now in her 6th group loan cycle with Turame. She is the mother of two children who are 3 and 1 ½ years old. She is requesting the loan from Kiva to diversify her business with food products such as cassava flour or palm nut oil, but also to improve the quality of the products she currently offers her customers. She hopes this will enable her to increase her revenue-generating ability, and also accumulate enough capital to become a wholesaler in the future. She will continue to request loans from Turame because their loan conditions are more flexible than those of other financial institutions. She is a member of the “Shishikara” communal loan group.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: diversify her business with food products such as cassava flour or palm nut oil, and improve the quality of the products she currently offers her customers

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa C. is from the village of  Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Felipa is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Felipa sells iced candy in the local community. Felipa has been engaged in her business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Felipa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felipa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Felipa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Felipa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 68 years old and is a farmer from the town of Murang'a in Central Province, Kenya. He has been farming for twelve years and employs two farm-hands. His main products are maize and beans which he sells to the local market.

Michael also receives income from his pension, from rental houses and from his quarry services to the locals. His biggest challenge has been lack of enough capital to expand his businesses.

Michael has requested this second loan of KES 65,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase three dairy goats and to build a dairy unit. He says that, with this loan, his family income will increase because of the expansion in his dairy business.

Michael would like to expand his dairy business by purchasing several pedigree goats and by building more rental houses. He says that Juhudi, unlike other financial institutions, is really helping farmers of small farms.

loans.use: To purchase three dairy goats and to build a dairy unit

loans.name: Leliosa

texts.en:
Leliosa A. is from the village of Poblacion. She is 54 years old. Leliosa is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Leliosa owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Leliosa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Leliosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leliosa has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Leliosa is requesting a new loan of 2,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 13th loan taken out by Leliosa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To extend her farming land and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn M. is from the village of Puntian, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 32 years old and is married with five school-aged children. Roselyn owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Roselyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional piglets. Roselyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac B. is 33 years of age, married to Mercy Komen, and they have been blessed with five children Jepkorir 12 years old, Kibet 10 years old, Kipruto eight years old, Jelagat six years old, and Gideon five years old. B. has been in the butchery business for the past two years and he gets a monthly profit of Kshs. 3,000.

Isaac is borrowing a loan of Kshs 15,000, his first loan with KADET LTD. He intends to use Kshs. 9,000 to buy five goats, two sheep for Kshs 3,000, and 10 hens for Kshs 3,000.

In case he get profit from this loan, Isaac anticipates expanding the business and also saving some money for the education of his children. Isaac dreams and hopes to expand his business and have enough income to support his family.

loans.use: Will be used to purchase livestock for slaughter

loans.name: Burema Women's, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
Hard working and cooperative Edith K. has been running a general merchandise retail shop from Burema trading centre in Kihihi, where she sells general merchandise and basic items for home use. She has been operating this business for over 6 years. She started this business with capital she got from farming business and so far it earns her 300,000 Ugandan Shillings. The mother of 8 children confirms that she has had problems in restocking her business as the stock available is not satisfying for the customers' demands.

Therefore she is seeking a loan to help her buy more goods for the business for resale in hopes of earning more income to cater for her family's needs, thus improve her standard of living. She belongs to Burema Women’s group with other members who hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for business.

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en:
Chhorn C., 40, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia – an area known for rubber plantations. C. and her husband are farmers, earning about $5 US per day. Two of her children are employed in the factories, earning $3 US each per day. The family has to spend $40 US on food, $5 US on electricity and water supplies and $10 US on other necessary expenses every month.

C. is requesting a loan of $500 US to purchase more equipment for her daughter to improve her hairdressing business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing equipment

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
This is Lucila M., 64, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Romeo M., a driver, and is the mother of four children, all of whom are already finished with school. At this time, she is working hard to be able to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Lucila operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings but also has seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 200 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and newspapers for patterns. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Lucila dreams that her business will be successful one day. She faithfully meets with her fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy materials like fabric, thread and newspapers for patterns

loans.name: Conrado

texts.en:
Conrado C. is from the town of Banga. He is 38 years old and married with four school-aged children. His eldest child is 16 and the youngest is only five. To make a living, Conrado owns and operates a business raising crops. His main source of income comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice. Conrado started farming at his parents’ farm when he was a teenager. He is thankful to have learned farming at an early age because he is now benefiting from the skills he has acquired over time.

Conrado joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase three sacks of fertilizers and other farm inputs. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Conrado from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to pay his children’s school tuition fees. 


About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and farm inputs

loans.name: Elsa Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Elsa; ella tiene 69 años y es viuda y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, ella vende en un pequeño stand en el distrito de san sebastian,la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su familia, siendo esto el medio para salir adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar equipos de celulares para el negocio de su hija y a la vez para comprar algunos insumos para su negocio.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank called "My Peru". The bank is located in the district, province and region of Cusco. 

Her name is Elsa.  She is 69 years old, she is a widow, and she has 3 children. She sells prepared foods for a living. She has a small food stand in the district of San Sebastian. She works together with her family, this being her only way to provide for herself. 

She requests a loan to purchase cell phones for her daughter’s business and to stock her own business with ingredients. 

She is grateful to all those who have become part of her dream. She is committed to the payment terms of her loan.

loans.use: To purchase cell phones for her daughter's business and ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Lucila Doris

texts.es:
Lucila es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas”  ubicado en el distrito y  provincia de Puno, tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene  02 hijos y estudio educación secundaria.

Esta  trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 08 meses, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 200.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su tienda de abarrotes.

Con éste nuevo crédito de S/. 100.00 nuevos soles, comprará lanas para tejer sus chompas, también nos cuenta que comprará un poco de mercadería para su tienda.

Su visión en el negocio es ampliar y convertir su tienda en una bodega.
	
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad de los préstamos.
texts.en:
Lucila is a member of the 'Las Kantutas' community bank which is located in the district and province of Puno.  She is 37 years old and lives with her common-law husband and two children who are in high school.

Lucila has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 8 months.  Her first loan was for 200 Peruvian soles and she invested it in her grocery store.

She will use this new loan for 100 Peruvian soles to buy yarn for knitting her sweaters.  She also tells us that she will buy a small amount of merchandise for her store.

Lucila's vision for her business is to expand her store.  What she likes most about her community bank is the ease of obtaining a loan.

loans.use: To buy groceries: sugar, rice, noodles, etc.  To buy yarn.

loans.name: Ramonito

texts.en:
Ramonito L. is from the town of Banga. He is 61 years old. Ramonito is married and has one child. He grows rice and corn on his land. He spends most of the day tilling the farm and keeping it free of weeds and pests. He also grows pigs for fattening. He sells the pigs to the market.

Ramonito joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Ramonito is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and feed. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and feed

loans.name: Léster Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor Léster Alfonso P. V. es conductor de Transporte Liviano en la Empresa Nicaragüense de Acueductos y Alcantarillado ENACAL desde hace 10 años.

El es casado con una persona a su cargo solamente su esposa. Es el primer crédito que trabaja en CEPRODEL, lo necesita para comprar una moto y poder transportarse más rápido y más barato a su centro de trabajo.
texts.en:
Léster has been Light Transport Vehicle driver for 10 years for ENACAL, a Nicaraguan Water and Sewage company.
He is married and has no children. 

This is his first loan with CEPRODEL. He is requesting the loan to buy a motorcycle so that he can commute to work quicker and more economically.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Baasanjav

texts.en:
Baasanjav D., 43, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Uvurhangai province in Mongolia. They live in a small house that they purchased through XacBank on a small plot of land that they have owned for the past two years. Her husband operates a taxi service using his own car. Both of their children attend a local secondary school. A high school graduate, she is a sociable person who says, "I am trying my best to raise my children well and give them a good education."

In 2008 Baasanjav began her current business selling clothes. She rents a stall at the Baku trade center to sell her goods. She uses the profits she makes from her clothing business to pay bank loans and support the needs of her family. She now has many regular customers and is running a stable business. She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase more clothing for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing

loans.name: Sarwa Wiguna Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut N. is the leader of the group. Currently Ni Ketut N. lives with her husband, I Nengah Wingga, and a daughter who has been working.
The current loan for Ni Ketut N. self is Rp.1,500,000 has been used to buy four piglets. As ussual, the piglets are for fattening and will be maintained for 4 to 5 months. From the results of her efforts, Ni Ketut N. can get a profit of about Rp. 500,000  to Rp.1,000,000. The expectation is that this pig farming business will get bigger and the family's income will increase and she can repay the loan to MUK.

loans.use: To buy four piglets

loans.name: Lay's Group

texts.en:
There are fourteen people who make up this village bank loan. Mr. Lay, who was born in 1952, is the village bank president.  He was selected to be the village bank president by the other members.  He is a farmer who owns a plot of land which he uses to grow rice for a living.  His wife, Mrs. Nhoem is a grocery seller who is able to earn a small income to support her family. 

Since his wife's business is doing well, he wants to expand it.  In order to enlarge his wife's business, he is asking for a loan to buy more groceries for her business.  This couple has four children: one is a laborer, one stays at home, and the others two are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for his wife's grocery business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a big shop and some new tools for his business of bicycle repair

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en: Mrs. Sitha C. (who we see in the photo) makes a living as a weaver and her husband, Mr. Det Sam, makes a living building houses. They have been married since 1980, have two married daughters and live on an Island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Mrs. Sitha C. hopes to continue her weaving business and has applied for a loan of $300 to buy the supplies she needs to make this happen.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her weaving business.

loans.name: Iftisam

texts.en:
Iftisam is a 30-year-old mother of three from the Negev. For reasons of modesty, Iftisam wears a veil in her photograph. Iftisam prepares handmade weaving and artwork. She runs her business part-time to develop much needed income for her family. She also works part-time as a speciA. needs Teacher's Assistant. Iftisam has been managing her business for just over 18 months and has gained a reputation for quality goods.

She needed this loan to purchase cloth, yarn, beads and the specialty screens needed to create her products.

Iftisam eventually wants to open a small shop in the center of her village so she can expand her business and provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, yarn, beads and the specialty screens needed to create her products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials to make crafts.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a resident and farmer in Nkubu area of Central Kenya. He has been in farming for 5 years and employs one farmhand. He is single. His farm produces bananas, milk, vegetables and beans. He earns additional income from his emloyment as a driver.

Amos has made a second loan request with Juhudi Kilimo, amounting to 80,000 KES. This will enable him to cultivate a bigger and better banana plantation for commercial purposes. He adds that he wants to continue doing bigger and bigger farms. This will enable him to gain on economies of scale and he believes that he will be able to uplift his standard of living and make his asset base stronger. He specifies that the Juhudi loan allowed him to acquire his own piece of land and he would like to continue doing the same.

Amos also points out that fluctuating market prices and pests are the greatest threat to their businesses.

loans.use: To pay for more cultivation commercial banana plantation

loans.name: Gai

texts.en: Gai is living in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Ghazanchi.  He is happily married with three sons (seven-year-old twins and a six-year-old).  Gai considers himself a hard worker and has been working on the family farm for the past ten years.  He has a high school education and would like his children to attend university.  Gai would like a loan to purchase materials to expand his cattle shed.  With the investment, he expects the family income to increase by twenty-five percent.  With some of the proceeds, Gai will do some remodeling of the family home.  He is pleased with the services of microfinance.

loans.use: to purchase materials to expand the cattle shed

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es:
María Virginia D. 36 años, vive con su familia en su casa propia, L. cual cuenta con servicio sólo D. luz, ubicada en el distrito D. Mórrope que pertenece al departamento D. Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por ser agrícoL., ganadera y artesana.

DesD. hace algunos años María Virginia ha colocado en su domicilio un pequeño negocio donD. ofrece productos D. primera necesidad a sus vecinos, con L. intención D. tener más ingresos económicos para su casa, tiene su propia clienteL., con los ingresos que obtenga por L. venta D. sus productos, podrá solventar sus obligaciones familiares.

María Virginia ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 2000 nuevos soles para L. compra D. más productos D. consumo diario, para poder surtir su tienda con L. finalidad D. satisfacer L. necesidad D. sus clientes y con los ingresos que obtenga por sus ventas podrá pagar su crédito otorgado y tener una mejor calidad D. vida.  María Virginia es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y una madre que se preocupa por el bienestar D. su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Virginia is 35 years old and married.  She has her own house in the Santa Rosa annex in the C. del Médano village.  It is 15 minutes from the Mórrope district.

Maria Virginia has her own small store set up in her house.  She takes care of the business herself.  She sells to the neighbors and customers in the area.  She sells basic needs products and groceries.  The business is well received.  She also sells ice cream from a cart in an itinerant manner.  With these business activities she helps her husband economically support her family.

The growing demand that María Virginia’s store has been experiencing has maD. her think of expanding it and getting more products.  Therefore, she has believed it to be advisable to request a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

María Virginia is a very hard-working woman, who is of very good character. She is responsible and worries about her family.

loans.use: To purchase oil, rice, sugar, noodles, etc. for her grocery store

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila de 47 años de edad, convive con su pareja Marcial y fruto de ello concibieron 03 hijos las cuales vienen cursando la etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de San Antonio, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tienen su propia casa. Teofila, menciona que todo lo que va obteniendo es a base de tenacidad y entrega a sus cultivos de cacao, café y plátanos, es por ello que trata de dar el mejor cuidado respectivo a sus plantaciones y bajo esa propuesta es que muchos de sus compradores se han sentido satisfechos por la calidad de sus productos. Por ello trata de esmerarse en dedicarle más tiempo a sus productos, conjuntamente con la ayuda de su pareja, pero en tiempos de cosecha necesita el apoyo de los peones, para que de esa manera pueda avanzar con rapidez en las extracciones de los frutos. Su plan a futuro es invertir sus ingresos en otro tipo de negocios como la crianza de cuyes. Este será su cuarto crédito y esta muy contenta de saber que contará una vez mas con el apoyo de ustedes y esta dispuesta a cumplir puntualmente con el rol de sus cronogramas de pago. En su banco comunal es una socia muy cooperadora. Con el dinero del crédito adquirirá plantas de café, para ampliar sus cultivos y así obtener mayores ingresos a medida que las plantas broten sus frutos.
texts.en:
Teofila, age 47, lives with her life partner, Marcial, and their three children.  The children go to school.  They live in San Antonio, which is in the beautiful Ayacuchan jungle, where they have their own house.

Teofila says that everything they have been getting stems from tenacity and the dedication to her cacao, coffee, and banana crops.  That is why she tries to give her crops the best care.  By doing this a lot of her buyers have been pleased with the quality of her products.  She therefore tries, together with help from her life partner, to take great care in devoting more time with her crops.  However, during harvesting times she needs the help of field workers.  This way she is able to gather the crop production more quickly.  

Her plan for the future is to invest her earnings in a different type of business like raising guinea pigs.

This will be her fourth loan.  She is very happy to know that she can once again count on your support.  She is prepared to make her payments punctually.  She is a very helpful member of her communal bank.  She will use the money from the loan to buy coffee plants.  She will do this in order to increase her crops and to get greater income when the plants are mature.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Sokchhun

texts.en: Sokchhun (in the photo) and his wife Yem are rice farmers who also produce rice wine and raise pigs. They have been married since 2004 and have three children – two sons and one daughter. One is in school and other two are still young. The family lives along National Road Six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. Sokchhun is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to buy three more pigs to raise, as well as feed for his pigs.

loans.use: to buy three more pigs to raise, as well as feed for his pigs

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children. 

Thelma has a shop that sells snacks, beverages, & canned goods. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 16,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, & beverages. 

Thelma has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Thelma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, & beverages

loans.name: Kalbubu's Group

texts.en:
Kalbubu is the treasurer of this group. She is 58 and married to a teacher. Together with her husband, she has raised five sons and two daughters. The youngest son studies at the university and all the other children are married and live separately with their families. Six years ago, with an initial investment of 5000 soms, Kalbubu started to provide sewing services. She sews Kyrgyz national felt products. In this way, she adds an additional 5,000 soms to family budget. This profit helps her to meet their daily needs. Kalbubu applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase more wool, fabrics and materials. In the future, with the profits gained from this business, she wants to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more wool, fabrics and materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Kasiwa

texts.en:
Kasiwa is a married man. He has five children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, he has operated a green grocery business, selling in a shop and from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 he wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, onions and tomatoes. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Jonny Manolo

texts.es: Jonny, es casado de 35 años de edad,y tiene tres hijos,el inicio vendiendo lacteos,pero no le funciono,despues decidio vender por su cuenta plataninas,con un ciento de bolsas para empacar y un ciento de platanos,poco a poco,conforme sus negocio fue creciendo, pudo comprar una moto y contrato a una persona para que le ayudara a vender su producto,actual mente el tiene a 6 personas que le ayudan a elavorar su producto,con el credito que solicito anterior mente,pudo crecer y comprar vitrinas de vidrio para poner en las tiendas su producto,su sueño es crecer y tener un capital mas grande para agrandar mas su ventas y ayudar a su familia para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.el esta solicitando este credito para la copra de platanos para elavorar plataninas.
texts.en:
Jonny is 35 years old and married, with three children.  He started selling dairy products but it didn't workout, so afterwards he decided to sell plantain chips on his own account, starting with 100 bags for packaging and 100 plantains.  Little by little his business has grown, and he has been able to buy a motorbike and hire someone to help him out with selling his product.  Currently he has six people helping him with production.

With his previous loan, he was able to grow and to buy glass display cases to put in the stores for his product.  His dream is to grow and to have greater capital to expand his sales even further and help his family by giving his children a better future.

He is requesting this loan for the purchase of plantains for making plantain chips.

loans.use: to buy plantains for making plantain chips.

loans.name: Soncarima Group

texts.en:
Rudo is 52 years old and lives in Masvingo. She is married and her husband is a clerk. They have two children and also look after one other dependant.

She raises and sells chickens and has been doing this for 6 years. Business is going well but she does have problems with bad debts and the high level of competition. In addition, the electricity supply is unreliable and the birds are vulnerable to disease.

She intends to spend the money she is lent on purchasing day-old chicks and feed.
Rudo hopes that this loan will help her to improve the living standards of her family and enable her to buy more food and better clothes. In the future, she hopes to increase the scale of her business.

loans.use: To buy day-old chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Dukorerehamwe Zone 2 Group

texts.fr:
Jean  fait partie du groupe Dukorerehamwe/zone 2. Le nom du groupe signifie « travaillons ensemble ». Il a 30 ans et il est marié avec 4 enfants de 3 à 8 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de secondaire.

Jean est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’achat des autres champs. Dans les prochaines années, Jean voudrait de construire une maison  de stockage du riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean is a member of the Dukorerehamwe group in zone 2. The group's name means "let’s work together". Jean is 30 years old and married with four children aged 3 to 8. Two of them are in school. Jean himself attended six years of high school.

Jean is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his credit to buy fertilizers.

His business growth strategy is to acquire additional farming fields. In the coming years, he wants to build a rice storage installation. With the profits, he plans to provide for his children’s education and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his rice farming activity

loans.name: Eunice Awuor

texts.en: Eunice is a 40-year-old widowed woman. She has five children, ranging from 6 to 20 years old. She describes herself as God-fearing and humble. Eunice operates a water-distribution services business where she sells water to the local people in Kisumu. She has been involved in this business for 14 years. Her business is located in a densely populated slum area. She says her biggest business challenge is insecurity. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more water and water storage containers. Her goal is to grow her business into a big business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more water and water storage containers.

loans.name: Amirsho

texts.ru: Амиршо житель города Душанбе. Ему 37 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его дети учатся в средней школе. Амиршо имеет высшее медицинское образование. По профессии он фармацевт. Уже два года как он открыл свою аптеку в городе. Он берет кредит для приобретения необходимых медикаментов.
texts.en: Amirsho is a resident of the city of Dushanbe. He is 37 years old. He is married and has four children. His children are in middle school. Amirsho has a degree in medicine, and is a pharmacist by profession. He has run his own pharmacy for two years. He is applying for a loan to purchase medical supplies for his business.

loans.use: to buy medicines for his business

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es:
Eduarda es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Barbara” del distrito, provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene  35  años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos.  Cuenta  con estudios de educación primaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco años, su primer préstamo fue por las suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio de venta de animales  como ovejas, chanchos y gallinas.  Paralelamente se dedica a la venta de bayetas (telares).

Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,800.00 nuevo soles, comprará diez  paquetes de lana para la fabricación  de bayetas, la señora cuenta que los conos de lana los compra a S/. 33.00 y 22.00 nuevo soles.  Las bayetas las vende en la localidad de Juliaca y Arequipa.  Ella trabajan junto con su esposo.

Su sueño es comprar otros telares y comprar un terreno.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la puntualidad, los pagos, el ahorro y las capacitaciones que ofrecen las Promotoras de créditos.
texts.en:
Eduarda is a member of the 'Santa Barbara' community bank which is located in Yunguyo district and province, in Puno department.  She is 35 years old, married, and has two children.  She has an elementary school level of education.

Eduarda has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years.  Her first loan was for 300 soles and she invested that money in her business selling animals such as sheep, pigs and hens.  In parallel with this work, she also sells woven cloths.

Eduarda will use this new loan for 2,800 soles to buy ten packets of yarn for making cloths.  She tells us that she buys the cones of yarn for 33 and 22 soles.  She sells her cloths in the towns of Juliaca and Arequipa and works alongside her husband.

Eduarda's dream is to buy more looms and a plot of land.  What she most likes about her community bank are the punctuality, the payments, the savings and the training sessions which are run by the loan officers.
