loans.use: to buy ten packets of yarn

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a divorced woman with four children who are enrolled in school. She owns a house with neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Mwaka has operated a café for the past three years. Her clients are the local area residents. Her major challenge is sufficient capital to expand her business. She dreams of establishing a grocery in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase corn flour, wheat flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil for her cafe. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase corn flour, wheat flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil for her cafe.

loans.name: Kewa Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Kewa SHG Group in Western Kenya! Everlyne is the facilitator of the Kewa SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Everlyne  takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Everlyne had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Everlyne was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Everlyne  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Everlyne will educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Kewa SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Maritta

texts.en:
Maritta is 37 years old and is married with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past six years, Maritta has operated a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Maritta is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing materials and to repair her fishing boat. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials and repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a 42-year-old business man, who lives in Juba. He is married and has 6 children between the ages of 28 and 6.  All of them go to school. 

Jacob runs a food store business, and he has been in this business for 3 years. He has 1 employee. Jacob heard about Finance Sudan from outreach and promotion done in the market by the loan officer. He is taking a loan of 2000 SDG to purchase more items like soda, milk, drinking water, and many others. In addition to this business, Jacob has no other source of income. 

In 5 years time, Jacob would like to build a house and increase the number of goods if not open another shop. His major challenges include the low income rate and high standard of living in Juba. Jacob says that he appreciates finance Sudan for considering men too for the loans because some of the MFIs consider women only.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soda, milk, drinking water, and many others.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 47-year-old married woman with 5 children. Her husband is a farmer.

Victoria has had a sari-sari store business for 15 years. She sells items like canned goods, soap, shampoo, vinegar and cooking oil. She also helps her husband grow rice crops on their land. She does her best to support her family.

She has requested this loan to buy fertilizers as well as more items to sell, such as canned goods, sugar and coffee. Victoria hopes to have a stable income to help sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers as well as more items to sell such as canned goods, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her flower growing business.

loans.name: Horacio

texts.en:
Mr Muniz is a true vendor. He currently sells fried pork rind, however his sales depend on the season. Another big seller for him is corn on the cob. The effort he puts into his business is evident in the dozens of clients that buy from him. He says, "I don't like to waste time, because it's very valuable to me. That's why I have a variety of products and when one runs low, I immediately begin to sell the other. At this time, I need a truck to outfit for sales. I really need it and so I am asking for a $1200 loan."

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. M. es comerciante de corazón pues actualmente tiene la venta de chicharrones, sin embargo lo que vende va con la temporada, otra de sus ventas fuertes es la de elotes. Las ganas que le pone al comercio se ven reflejadas en las decenas de clientes que acuden con él. "No me gusta perder el tiempo para mi es muy valioso, por eso tengo variedad de productos cuando se empieza a escasear un producto inmediatamente empiezo a trabajar en el otro, en este momento necesito una camioneta para acondicionarla, me hace mucha falta por eso les pido un monto de $1,200.00 dlls

loans.use: To buy a truck from which to sell product.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.en:
I bought my home more than a year ago. There was only one room at first, but little by little my wife and I have worked together and put up walls for two more rooms, but by the hand of fate we were not able to finish. We have three children, and a home with only one room is too small for our family. Which is why I'm requesting a loan of $500 so we're able to put up a roof over the two rooms so we can live more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Tengo mas de un año que adquirí la vivienda era solo un cuarto cundo no la entregaron poco a poco mi esposa y yo hemos juntado para hacer los muros de dos cuartos pero por cosa del destino no hemos podido terminarla, tenemos 3 hijos y la casa de un cuarto es demasiado pequeña para la familia. Por lo cual estoy solicitando un préstamo de $ 500.00 dlls para poner el techo de lamina a los dos cuartos para que pueden tener mejor comodidad.

loans.use: Put up a roof on the home extension

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul Q. is 40 years old and an inhabitant of Yavan district, Tajikistan. He has higher education, is married, and has got 5 children. Currently Abdul works as an engineer in the State Enterprise for Auto Road expansion, but he has also been doing stockbreeding for 20 years. This kind of activity is an additional source of income.

With the loan of $575, Abdul is going to buy 2 calves. This loan will help him to increase the number of cattle and will also give local inhabitants the opportunity to buy meat near home at a low price. Abdul is going to pay off the loan over a period of 8 months.

loans.use: to buy 2 calves

loans.name: Auk

texts.en: Mrs. Auk H., 44, lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a vendor selling vegetables in an open-air market and earns around $1 of profits each day. Her husband, meanwhile, works as a motor-taxi driver and a middleman buying and selling cows; one of her children is employed at a garment factory, another one works as a blacksmith and the rest  attend school. Mrs. Ouk Han hopes to use this loan to purchase an electrical metal cutter and other blacksmith’s tools for her son’s business. She believes this loan will make his business grow further and faster

loans.use: To purchase an electrical metal cutter and other blacksmith’s tools for her son’s business

loans.name: Neneng

texts.en: Neneng is 40 years old and is married. She sells kerosene and usually earns $5 per day. Her husband, M. Yusuf, is a driver with a salary of $10 per week. She is requesting a IDR 500,000 loan to complete her business. Neneng hopes that this will allow her business to improve and prosper. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To complete her business

loans.name: Nelly Olga

texts.es:
Olga is married, has 3 children and has been a member of the Lirio Community Bank for 3 years.

Olga sells automotive spare parts. She started this business 12 years ago renting a shop but this generated higher costs. She therefore decided to open the shop at her home but it did not have the right infrastructure. That is why she took a loan from the Community Bank and with it she built a roof on top of the house.

Now, Olga wants to further expand her business and she would like to enlarge her shop to sell more and open another spare parts shop as well.

Moreover, one month ago Olga bought a motorcycle that can be used as a taxi so her sons can work in their spare time. She requests a loan of 2400 soles (825 dls) which she will invest buying automotive spare parts like headlights, alternators and other plastic parts.

Olga learnt through her Community Bank to save, to have self-esteem and to better treat her clients. Her dreams are to see her sons learn a profession, to expand her spare parts business and to buy another motorcycle-taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga tiene 3 hijos, casada y es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio hace 3 años. Olga vende repuestos de carros y se inició en este negocio hace 12 años, en una tienda alquilada, la cual generaba mayores costos.

Por ello decidió abrir su negocio en su casa, la cual no estaba acondicionada pero posteriormente techó su casa con los ahorros que reunió en su Banco Comunal. Olga quiere que su negocio crezca, ella tiene pensado abrir otra tienda de repuestos y ampliar su tienda para vender más.

Además hace un mes compró una mototaxi para que sus hijos puedan trabajar en sus horas libres. Su préstamo es de 2400 soles que lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos, faros, micas y alternadores.

En su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar, a tener autoestima y también cómo atender al cliente. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales, ampliar su negocio y comprar otra mototaxi .

loans.use: Olga wants to further expand her spare parts shop buying more spare parts like headlights, alternators and other plastic parts

loans.name: Manal

texts.en: ManA. is 30 years old. She has 3 children and lives with her family in the region of Aley. She makes handicrafts. ManA. is supporting her family through this business. This is the third time ManA. has asked for a loan from A. Majmoua. She needs to buy materiA. to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy material

loans.name: Chingiz

texts.en: Chingiz (his father is pictured) lives in the town of  Khachmaz, Azerbaijan. He was born in 1978. Chingiz is single. He has been raising cattle for 10 years. Chingiz and his father need a loan of $850 to buy a cow for the business.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Haydee Filonila's Group

texts.es:
Haydee and Tania are associates of the Communal Bank "Rikchariy" which means "Wake Up" in Quechua since 12 and 1 year ago respectively. In their Communal Bank they learned to save, be responsible and rely on business partners.

Haydee is married, is 54 years old and has 4 children of whom only 2 live with her. Before, Haydee used to buy and sell cereals; currently she grows potatoes, beans and quinoa in her fields in the province of Sucre and in the District of Chiara, and she sells them in the city of Lima. What is more, Haydee creates clothing typical to the region of Sucre. Haydee has been thinking to start a "recreo" (a privately owned village center for recreation and food) in Sucre.

On the other hand Tania is cohabitating, 27 years old with two daughters. Tania sells cosmetics via catalogs; products she offers to friends and acquaintances. Also Tania sells algarrobina (local sweet carob syrup) coffee that has curative properties; she also sells craftwork. Those two products are local traD.-goods of the north of Peru.

Haydee and Tania need loans of 600 each one, money that will be invested in the purchase of algarrobina coffee, craftworks and to implement the "recreo" with tables and chairs.

Their savings for increasing the capital of their business. The dreams of Haydee and Tania are to expand their business, offer a good education to their children, to fulfill their professions and dedicate themselves to the growth of animal vaccines.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Haydee y Tania son socias del Banco Comunal “Rikchariy” que significa “Despiértate” en quechua, hace 12, 1 años respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ahorrar, ser responsable y el apoyo entre socias.

Haydee es casada, tiene 54 años y 4 hijos D. los cuales solo 2 viven con ella, Haydee antes compraba y vendía cereales, actualmente siembra papa, haba, quinua en sus terrenos D. la provincia D. Sucre y en el Distrito D. Chiara, y los venD. en la ciudad D. Lima. Además Haydee confecciona vestimenta típica D. la región D. Sucre. Haydee tiene proyectado iniciar un recreo en Sucre.

Por otro lado Tania es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 2 hijas, Tania venD. cosméticos por catálogos, productos que ofrece a amigos, familiares. Además Tania venD. café D. algorrobina que tiene propiedades curativas, también venD. artesanías, estos dos productos son traídos del norte del Perú.

Haydee y Tania necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles cada una, dinero que será invertido en la compra café D. algarrobina, artesanías y para implementar su recreo con mesas, sillas.

Sus ahorros son para incrementar el capital D. su negocio. Los sueños D. Haydee y Tania son ampliar su negocio, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, realizarse profesionalmente y dedicarse a la crianza D. animal vacuno.

loans.use: Haydee and Tania need loans of 600 each one, money that will be invested in the purchase of algarrobina coffee, craftworks and to implement the "recreo" with tables and chairs. - Haydee y Tania necesitan préstamos de 600 soles cada una, dinero que será invertido en la compra café de algarrobina, artesanías y para implementar su recreo con mesas, sillas.

loans.name: Chuob

texts.en:
Chuob T., age 47, lives with her husband and eight children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has a business selling groceries and earns around $1.5 a day of profit. Her husband, Sao Cheo, 48, is a construction worker building a house. He makes around $1 of profit per day. One son is a construction worker like his father and earns around $1.5 a day and two of their daughters are employed as garment factory workers with a salary of $70 each per month. The rest of their children are students.

To make the family's standard of living better and reduce the cost of commuting to work, Chuob T. would like to take a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike for her daughters to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her daughters for commute to work

loans.name: Francisco Camilo

texts.es:
Don Francisco is married and has 3 school-aged children. He lives in the Altagracia neighborhood of Managua, Nicaragua and he works as a welder. At 39 years of age, he has 10 years of experience in this field and he earns enough to support his family. His wife is an office worker and helps him with household expenses because they want to get ahead and to give their children a good education. Don Francisco wants to improve his shop’s appearance, and for that reason he is asking for credit. With the credit he will purchase construction materials in order to improve the facade not only of his business but also of his home. This will give his clients a better impression while simultaneously improving his own quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Francisco es casado y tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar. Habita en el barrio Altagracia de Managua y se dedica al oficio de soldadura eléctrica. A sus 39 años de edad, tiene 10 años de experiencia en este negocio que le dá el sustento para su familia. Su esposa es oficinista y le apoya en los gastos del hogar, porque como familia desen salir adelante y brindarle educación a sus hijos. Don Francisco desea mejorar las condiciones del local, es por eso que solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción y mejorar la fachada tanto de su negocio como de su hogar, para así poder brindar una mejor presentación a sus clientes, al mismo tiempo que mejora también sus calidad de vida.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials in order to improve the facade of his business and his home.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort D. sells fish. She is married and has three children, but her husband's income as a fisherman is insufficient to support the family's living expenses.

Fortunately, there is high demand for Comfort's fish, so she is now looking to capitalize on such demand by expanding her business in order to increase her profits. Thus, she is requesting additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on the high demand for her fish by expanding her business.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Wilmer G. and I have run a shop selling used clothing for the past 5 years.  I live with my mother and have the support of my two nephews in selling my product.  I have many clients since the clothing I sell is of high quality and I offer good prices.  

Currently, I need to purchase more used clothing to achieve higher sales and with the profits, I hope to finish constructing the bathroom of my home.  This is why I seek a loan in order to move my business and my family forward. 

 Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

hola mi nombre es Wilmere G. me dedico a la venta de ropa usada, actividad que realizo hace 5 años, vivo con mi madre, y tengo el apoyo de 2 sobrinos para vender mi producto, tengo muchos clientes ya que la ropa que vendo es de buena calidad y les doy buen precio. en estos momentos necesito comprar mas ropa usada para tener mas ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga deseo terminar de construir el baño y servicio sanitario de mi casa. por lo que pido ayuda para poder salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Abdurahmon.

texts.ru:
Abdurahmon Q. lives in the area of Khuroson. He is married and has six children. He has a very big family and therefore he has to work a lot so that he can support them. he works as a teacher at the high school, other than that he works in agriculture. He plans to get ready for the fall sowing season, and therefore he plans to receive a loan so that he can buy seed and fertilizer. This will help him grow a good crop, which he can than sell. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Курбоназаров Абдурахмон житель района Хуросон. Женат имеет шестерых детей. Очень большая семья , поэтому ему приходится много работать для того , чтобы прокормить семью. Работает учителем в средней школе. Кроме того занимается земледелием. Планирует подготовиться к осеннему посевному сезону, поэтому решил получить кредит для покупки семян и удобрений. Это поможет ему получить качественный урожай , который затем он сможет незамедлительно продать. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase of seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Akossiwoa

texts.fr: Née le 05 avril 1981 à Djagblé une petite localité à la périphérie de la ville de Lomé, madame A. Akossiwoa est mère de deux enfants. Revendeuse de fourniture scolaire elle à pris l’initiative d’augmenter sont stock pour cette rentrée scolaire et aussi diversifier sa marchandise. Son meilleur atout est qu’elle se situe géographiquement dans l’enceinte d’une école. Ainsi elle a besoin de ce premier crédit pour acheter de divers cahiers.
texts.en:
Born on April 5, 1981 in Djagblé, a little place on the periphery of the city of Lomé, Mrs. Akossiwoa A. is the mother of two children. She sells school supplies and has taken the initiative to add to her stock for the beginning of the school year and also to diversify her merchandise.

Her trump card is that she is located right by a schoolyard. Thus, she needs this first loan to buy various exercise books.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of school supplies for re-sale

loans.name: Heber Franz

texts.es:
Heber R. C. vive en casa de sus padres con su esposa, la señora Martha Huallpa en la zona de llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz junto con sus dos hijos.
Heber trabaja en una empresa de instalación de gas natural y su esposa es profesora de una unidad educativa de la zona en la que viven.
La pareja adquirió un lote de terreno que aun se encuentra sin construcción.
El crédito solicitado será destinado para construir dos habitaciones, de principio a fin (obra gruesa y fina), con lo cuál iniciarán el proceso de edificación de su futura casa
Esta es la primera vez que Heber solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado le califica favorablemente, por lo tanto, puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Heber R. C. lives with his wife, Martha Huallpa, in the Llojeta area of the city of La Paz and his two sons. Herber works at a natural gas installation company and his wife is a professor at the education centre in the region where they live. The couple acquired a lot that still hasn't been developed. The loan applied for will be destined for the contruction of two rooms, from beginning to end, and by doing so, initiating the edification of their future house. This is the first time Hereber applies for a loan. His credit record is very favourable and, thus, he is able to apply for credit.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CONSTRUCCIÓN

loans.name: 23 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
Este banco esta conformado por 14 integrantes, pertenece al Municipio D. la Guardia, Km. 9, del departamento D. Santa Cruz, Bolivia, en esta comunidad la mayoría D. las integrantes se dedican al comercio.
Maria del Carmen, Es la líder del grupo, es dueña D. casa y hace,  25 años que resiD. en la zona, vive con su esposo, tienen dos hijos. Tiene la actividad D. venta D. cosméticos, y el crédito que necesita es para invertir en el mismo negocio aumentando su capital D. trabajo. Y con el ahorro que vaya acumulando  con el tiempo quiere colocar una tiendita en su barrio.
Patricia León, es la secretaria del banco comunal, ella se dedica a la venta D. D. repuestos automovilisticos, la Sra. Patricia León vive en casa familiar con sus padres, tiene un hijo que vive con su esposo ya que son separados. ella aparte D. trabajar con el negocio  D. venta D. repuestos también estudia, tiene ganas D. superarse , con el tiempo  quiere llegar a tener su casa propia. 
Marlene  V. Rivera, es la tesorera del Banco comunal, ella vive en la misma localidad, tiene el negocio D. la venta D. cosméticos. Vive en la casa familiar cuenta con sus dos hijos. El negocio con el que cuenta actualmente es ambulante y D. la misma manera que las otras compañeras con el tiempo quiere llegar a colocar su negocio fijo.
texts.en:
This bank is maD. up of 14 members and pertains to the Municipality of La Guardia, Km. 9 in the district of Santa Cruz, Bolivia. Most of the members of this community make a living as salespeople. Maria del Carmen is the leader of the group. She owns her home and lived in this area for 25 years. She lives with her husband and they have two children. She sells cosmetics, and the loan she needs will be used for this business to increase her work capital. With her savings, she would like to set up a shop in her neighborhood. Patricia León is the secretary of the communal bank and sells car replacement parts. Mrs. Patricia León lives in a family owned home with her parents. She has one son who lives with her husband, since they are separated. With time, she would like to own a house. Marlene V. Rivera is the treasurer of the communal bank. She lives in the same area and sells cosmetics. She lives in a family home and has two children. She sells her products from door to door and just like her partners, she would like to have a stationary business.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Aida Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora de nombre Aída Del Rosario Pérez R. tiene la edad de 53 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Aída tiene 2 hijos un varón de la edad de 29 años que tiene su profesión como abogado y su hija mujer que tiene la edad de 27 años la profesión de esta joven es farmacéutica, su compañero de vida labora como abogad, en sus esta  el propósitos  mantener activo su negocio para así brindarle ayuda a su mama y a su hija que todavía depende de ella.



La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta en general como: ropa, calzados, cosmeticos, bolsos y otros, la ubicación de su negocio es de Asilo de anciano ½ c al norte en león, el tiempo que lleva en este negocio es de 18 años, esta señora además de es contadora por lo que de este modo conseguido administrar  bien   sus inicios se dan por la necesidad de buscar un trabajo y poder darle a sus hijos lo que ellos necesitaban y empezó a luchar por ellos, inicia con la venta de comida, ropa y caramelos y es así como va incrementando su negocio por lo que es necesario el financiamiento para el capital de trabajo ya que ella viaja  a Panamá para traer productos extranjeros y de calidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aída Del Rosario Pérez R. is 53 years and married. She has two children. Her son is 29 years old and works as a lawyer and her daughter is 27 years and works as a pharmacist. Aída's husband and lifelong companion also works as a lawyer and she works too, because she wants to stay active and also, to help support her mother and daughter, who are dependent on her. She has dedicated herself to retailing for 18 years and sells clothing, footwear, cosmetics, bags etc. She began this work because at the time, the family needed extra income and she wanted to give her children everything they needed. At first, she started by selling meals, clothes and sweets but slowly her business has grown over the years and now she travels to seek out the best quality merchandise. She will use this loan to import some products from Panama. Aída also does all the accounting for her business herself, believing that this is the best way to continue succeeding.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Dipu

texts.en:
Mrs. Dipu M. is a 36-year-old lady who lives in Tangal, Lalitpur District, Nepal. She lives in a single family with her husband, Mr. Mangal M., and their two sons. Her older son is in grade 9 and her younger son is in primary school. 
Mrs. M. and her husband opened their kitchenware shop six years ago. In their shop they sell different types of steel items including dinner plates, glasses, jugs, spoons, cups, cooking pots, and much more. The income from the shop meets the basic needs of the family. Now they are requesting for their second loan of NPR30000.00 (US$400.00) from Kiva to buy  more steel goods and expand the shop.

loans.use: To buy steel kitchenware

loans.name: Kol

texts.en: 36-year-old K. is a resident of Banteay Meanchey Province. She works as both a cultivator and a seamstress in her village. For eight years, she has been sewing clothes, a skill she learned from her grandmother. Her husband, Mr. Dong Seum, 43, works at the CMAC Organization earning $180 a month to support his family. K. is asking for a loan of $1000 to build a well at her home. She hopes this will help her expand her business, as well as improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To build a well

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is single. She offers retail items such as groceries, jewelry and fancy goods in a local grocery market in Stryi, Western Ukraine. Irina owns a kiosk and a vending stall. Irina launched her business on the advice of her mother who supported her from the very beginning. Irina has set a reasonable pricing policy and that became one of the reasons why many clients come to her for groceries and other inventory. Irina has been in this business only for 3 years. She already has about 25,000 Grivnas in inventory.

Irina has employed three vendors who work for her. This time she is hoping to get a loan for 9,000 Grivnas to further develop her business. Irina is very sharp and learns fast. She always listens to the advice of other entrepreneurs who are more experienced and have been in business longer. We believe her managerial abilities and focused attitude will secure prompt loan repayment and further success of her trade.

loans.use: To develop her business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence sells provisions and foodstuffs. She hopes to expand this business. She hopes for a loan in the amount of N70,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
"My name is Naheed and I have been a citizen of a city named Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. My husband's name is S. A. and he runs a tea stall in the food market. People come to him for taking tea and for making chit chat because my husband’s behavior is very friendly with the customers." 

Naheed baji supports her husband by sewing clothes. She sews clothes to share the financial burden of her husband. Her husband is very happy with her behavior. She is applying for a loan to buy ingredients (tea, sugar, and milk) for her husband’s tea stall.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for tea stall

loans.name: Noumea

texts.en: Noumea A., 42, is married with five children. She has five years of experience in the vegetable garden business. She sells to the general public seven days a week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD). SPBD loans are Noumea’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use the loan to buy raw materials needed to upgrade her business.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizers and vegetable seeds for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Guilerma

texts.en:
Guilerma B.'s business is a piggery. She started it in 1990 using her small savings. At first, she only had two sows. Now she has more pigs and wants to make it grow in the future. She married a farmer, Adolfo B.. Her husband is very supportive of her and her business. The income from the piggery goes to pay the tuition and other school fees of her children. Education is important for Guilerma. She wants all her children to graduate from college.

She is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy pig feed. She will also construct another pig fence for additional pigs that she plans to raise. CEVI is helping her sustain and grow her business. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Justice

texts.en: Justice C. is a trader who deals in electrical parts at Elmina. Justice has received a senior high school education. He is single and has no children. Justice has been selling electrical parts since 2006. He is responsible for paying light and water bills. His loan will be used to purchase electrical wires and other goods to sell. He hopes to use the new profits to expand the business.

loans.use: His loan will be used to purchase electrical wires and other goods.

loans.name: Rengie

texts.en:
Rengie V. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 27 years old, married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Rengie owns and operates a business involving computers and ink toner refilling. While not her only means for generating revenue, her main source of income is from her internet cafe. Rengie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rengie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC to purchase equipment to improve her business. Rengie is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase equipment. This loan will be her third taken from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

------------------------- About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase equipment.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua S. is seventy years old. She is divorced and has given birth to six children: two sons and four daughters. According to her, all her children are out of school and working. She lives with some of her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Akosua is a trader. She trades in cereals such as maize, beans, etc. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices and sells them in the market square in her community. She supplies to food vendors and retailers. She also treks to other markets to sell her cereals. Akosua has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and sponsor all her children to complete their education.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Harch

texts.en:
Harch H., 33, is engaged in the business of sewing clothes from her house in Battambong Province, and typically earns around US$ 5 per day. She is married and has two school-aged children. Her husband operates a motorbike, providing transportation services for his customers in the village and at the nearby local markets.

To generate more income for the family, she really wants to take out a loan of US$500 to buy a new sewing machine for her daughter. By doing this, H. hopes that she will be able to have enough money to put into savings, and for the family’s expenses. Also, one of her daughters will be able to use her skill for the family’s benefit.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Adèle

texts.fr: Adèle D. est âgée de 48 ans, veuve et mère de 3 enfants. Elle fait un commerce de légumes et divers produits tropicaux. Elle souhaiterait renforcer le capital de son activité pour mieux subvenir et améliorer les besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Adèle D., age 48, is a widow and the mother of 3 children. She sells vegetables and various tropical products. She would like to bolster her working capital to better support her family, and to improve its standard of living.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell vegetables and tropical products

loans.name: Sharipha

texts.en:
Sharipha is a member of the Kajificheni borrower group in Ilala,Iringa.she is 40 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 5children.Her children are aged 22,15,14,12 and 8 years.

Sharipha started her own clothing business selling clothes 12 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Sharipha first loan from BRAC _Tanzania,she requested the amount of 400,000 Tsh in order to buy clothes.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan sharipha hopes to save money ,pay school fees,get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 41 años de edad, es casada, y vive junto a su esposo y sus siete hijos en el pueblo joven Jesús Nazareno, distrito de Monsefú, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de pescado en el mercado de la ciudad de Pomalca, ubicada a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo; donde vende sus productos que compra en el terminal pesquero de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, a 10 minutos del lugar en donde vive.

Su esposo se dedica eventualmente a la pesca artesanal y con el dinero recaudado entre ambos tratan de sacar adelante a su familia, pero lo que perciben no es suficiente para sostenerlos, es por ello que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más pescado para vender.

Su más grande anhelo es brindarle a sus siete hijos la posibilidad de asegurarse un futuro prometedor estudiando una carrera técnica o superior.

Rosa es muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos y compañeros del mercado que la consideran una mujer alegre y responsable y que todos los día trabaja arduamente por sacar adelante a su hogar.
texts.en:
Rosa is 41 and married. She lives with her husband and their seven children in the Pueblo Joven Jesús Nazareno in the Monsefú district, which is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has been selling fish for four years in the market in city of Pomalca, which is located ten minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She sells the products that she buys in the fish terminal in the city of Santa Rosa, which is ten minutes from where she lives. Her husband works occasionally as a traditional local fisherman. With the money collected between the two of them, they try to get ahead for their family. But, what they receive is not enough to support them. That is why they have seen the necessity of asking our institution, for the first time, for a loan for 600 PEN. They plan to buy more fish to sell. Her biggest wish is to provide her seven children with the possibility of assuring themselves of a promising future by studying a technical field or getting a college education. Rosa is well known and held in high esteem by her neighbors and colleagues in the market. They consider her to be a happy and responsible woman who works arduously every day to give her household a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fish to sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina sells foodstuffs in retail to her customers. She has been in this business for long. She hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She is 48 years old and married with 2 children. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat des pièces détachées

loans.name: Jose Salomon

texts.es: José Salomón tiene 50 años, a su edad ha logrado trabajar lo suficiente para ayudar a su familia. Su actividad económica es venta y elaboración de mochilas. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio, el dio inicio a este negocio por su familia ya que su Papa le había enseñado este medio de vida, para que ganara algo de dinero y pudiera mantener a su familia. Actualmente el trabaja muy duro todos los días ya que después tiene venderlas en los diferentes departamentos. El sueño de José es tener su propio taller en donde obtenga mayor producción. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de cuero, tela, zipper y agujas.
texts.en:
José Salomón is 50 years old and and, at this age, has worked enough to be able to help his family. He makes and sells backpacks or satchels . He has been involved in this activity for over 15 years since his father taught him how to earn his livelihood through this type of work. His goal was to make enough money to support his family. Currently he must work very hard every day because after making them he has to go sell them in different departments. His dream is to have his own workshop where he can increase his production. The financing he is requesting will be used as working capital which will be invested in the purchase of leather, fabric, zippers, and sewing needles.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Lucerito Group

texts.es: El grupo " Lucerito " Esta representado por la señora Marleny y conformada por 12 socias muy trabajadoras y que van cumpliendo su tercer ciclo juntas demostrando responsabilidad, unión y sobre todo expectativas D. lograr mejorar mas aun su calidad D. vida y la D. su familias. Las señoras tienen una amistad desD. hace mucho tiempo y son muy dinámicas en su trabajo, sus actividades comerciales son la venta D. pan, tienda D. abarrotes, venta D. comida y venta D. cosméticos, algunas atienden en sus domicilios propios y otros son ambulantes.  En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores si bien están presentes en el barrio, pero las socias tienen sus clientes que constantemente generan el movimiento económico necesario para un ingreso capaz D. sustentar a sus familias.  El crédito  esta destinado a la compra D. mercadería para surtir sus tiendas e insumos al por mayor como azúcar, harina para la producción D. pan, las promotoras D. cosméticos aprovechan las ofertas  para obtener una mejor ganancia. Sus mayores expectativas es  tener más ingresos y ser más independientes económicamente para poder llegar a tener un mejor capital y un mejor ingreso para el sustento D. sus familias.
texts.en:
Marleny represents the Lucerito group. It is comprised of 12 very hard-working members. They are completing their third cycle together. They demonstrate responsibility; union; and, above all, the expectation to improve the quality of life for themselves and their families. The women have had a friendship for a very long time. They are very dynamic in their work. They sell bread, have a grocery store, sell food, and sell cosmetics. Some work in their own homes, and others are street vendors. As far as competition goes, it does exist in their neighborhood. But, the members have their customers who continually generate enough economic movement to get an income that will support their families. The loan is to buy merchandise to stock their stores and wholesale supplies like sugar and flour to make bread. The cosmetic representatives will take advantage of offers to get better earnings. Their greatest expectation is to have more income and to be more economically independent. They want to have more capital and better income to support their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Lilieta

texts.en:
Lilieta D. is from the village of Dawo. She is 58 years old. Lilieta is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Lilieta owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Lilieta has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP average per month for these activities.

In 2008, Lilieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Lilieta is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lilieta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.es:
Carmelina tiene 54 años de edad, es casada y madre de cuatro hijos. Vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia hizo que viajara a trabajar al país de Chile. Hace un año regresó con el objetivo de trabajar en su país haciendo lo que más le gusta: cocinar. Fue así que instaló un restaurante en un local alquilado a un costado de la carretera Panamericana. Allí ella prepara diversos platos típicos que ofrece a los tranportistas, turistas y público en general que frecuentan la zona.

La clientela ha ido creciendo durante este tiempo gracias a su buena sazón y buen trato. Carmelina desea preparar más platos para hacer crecer su negocio pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de platos típicos.

Carmelina nos comenta que su sueño es poder establecerse en un local propio y que ya está trabajando en ello. Ella ya ha trabajado con nosotros anteriormente y ha demostrado ser una cliente responsable al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
54-year old Carmelina is married and has four children. She and her husband live in Paiján district, Ascope province, in the region of La Libertad, about three hours from the city of Chiclayo. In order to provide for her family, Carmelina used to have to travel to Chile to get work. She returned a year ago to work in Peru doing what she most enjoys: cooking. She opened a restaurant in rented premises located on the the Panamerican highway. There she cooks a variety of traditional meals for truck drivers, tourists, and the general public. The number of customers has been increasing over the year because of the tasty food and good service. Carmelina wishes to prepare more dishes so that her business can grow, but she lacks the necessary capital. She has applied to Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 soles to purchase ingredients. Carmelina says that her dream is to open a restaurant in premises that she herself owns and she is working towards fulfilling that dream. Carmelina has been a client of Edpyme Alternativa before and shown herself to be responsible in the repayment of her loan installments.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making traditional foods

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 22-year-old single lady with no children. She lives with alone in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Mary works hard to be able to provide for herself. She is a trader. She trades in pastries. She prepares the pastries and supplies to retailers and snack bar operators in her community. She buys bags of flour from nearby towns. Mary has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en: Kiden R. is currently in the business of selling food in her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock crates of beer and sodas to sell. Kiden is 27 years old and is married to an accountant. She has two children, both of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Kiden hopes to be able to open a hotel (meaning a larger restaurant). About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock crates of beer and sodas to sell

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco J. es una persona trabajadora que desde hace 28 años se dedico a ser voceador de un periódico muy conocido y saco a sus hijos adelante, hace poco quedo viudo pero aún así quiere hacerle mejoras a su casa, por que el techo es de  lamina lo cual  esta muy deteriorada y necesita comprar nuevas laminas para que no se le trasmine el agua cuando llueve o se sienta muy frió en el invierno. 
Este proyecto que el tiene es mas que todo para no sufrir tanto la soledad y la tristeza de haber perdido un ser querido muy importante en su vida.
texts.en:
Francisco J. is a hard working man that has been a well-known news reporter for the past 28 years and has worked hard to raise his children. His wife passed away not too long ago but he still wants to improve his home, as the ceiling is falling apart and he needs to fix it to stop the rain from coming in, and so that his house doesn't get as cold in the winter. This project means a lot to him now, and working on it will help Francisco not suffer as much the loniless and sadness of having lost a very important person in his life.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix home's ceiling

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 53 years old and she is the mother of 7 children. She is a hard-working woman and she is also experienced in her business. She sells planks at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to sell planks at wholesale prices to her customers in the future. She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 120,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She sells for long hours to enable her to assist her husband in meeting the basic needs of her family. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Mila Maniego Group

texts.en:
Mila M. is from the town of Lawy, Capas Tarlac. She is 38 years old. Mila is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Mila is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Mila owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Mila is just starting this business.

In 2010, Mila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mila is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mila from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Orn

texts.en:
Mrs. Orn Sann, age 35, and her husband, Mr. Sophak Tit, age 32, live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2004 and have no children yet. She also has her sister, who is a rice farmer, living with her. 

Orn has been selling fruit (banana and mango) for five years. She buys fruits under contract from her village and transports to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been a wooden-house builder for fifteen years, a skill he learned from his uncle. 
Orn doesn’t have enough capital to purchase mango for resale, so she is requesting her first loan of 200USD to help her capital.

loans.use: To purchase mango under contract for resale.

loans.name: Jose Enrique

texts.es:
El  Sr. José Enrique P. trabaja en la Alcaldía de Puerto Morazán Tonalá que está ubicada en el municipio del Viejo, departamento de Chinandega.

El  va a utilizar el crédito para reparar su vivienda ya que necesita reparación en el techo de su casa.


Este es el cuarto  crédito que tiene con la Institución y todos los anteriores  siempre los han pagado  bien,  y a la vez dice estar muy agradecido con Ceprodel por la  ayuda que siempre le han brindado.
texts.en:
Mr. José Enrique P. works for the town of Puerto Morazán Tonalá, which is located in the Viejo municipality, Chinandega department. He will use this loan to repair his dwelling. The roof of his house needs work. This is his fourth loan with our institution, and he has a good credit history. He says he is very grateful to CEPRODEL (local lending institution) for the help it has always given to him.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of dwelling

loans.name: Beatriz Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Beatriz del Socorro R. S., tiene la edad de 29 años habita con su esposo y sus dos hijos en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, ellos son una familia muy humilde, ella labora desde hace 4 años a vendiendo Panadería de la Repostería Norma y el señor labora como chofer de automóviles. 

Dentro de las necesidades que agoban a la familia, esta la construcción de su vivienda, debido a que actualmente, viven en un cuarto con todos sus hijos en precarias condiciones habitacionales, los pocos ingresos que tiene la familia imposibilita la compra de materiales de construcción para el emprendimiento de dicho proyecto, hasta el momento lo único que han podido comprar ha sido 200 bloques, razón por la cual solicitan un préstamo para realizar las compras necesarias para dar inicio a las edificaciones, este apoyo les servirá para encaminara sus hijos en un ambiente hogareño que favorezca al crecimiento social de su familia.
texts.en:
Beatriz del Socorro R. Sanchez, age 29, lives with her husband and her two children in the Juan Ramón Padilla housing development. They are a very humble family. She has worked for four years selling for Norma’s Bakery and Pastries. Her husband works as a driver. One of the family’s great needs is building their house. They currently live in one room with all of their children. Their living conditions are precarious. The family’s small income makes it impossible to buy construction materials to start this project. The only things they have been able to buy are 200 blocks. That is the reason they are asking for a loan to make the necessary purchases to start building. This help will serve to lead their children to a homey environment that favors the social growth of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build her house

loans.name: Hosana Group

texts.es:
El grupo Hosana está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora Ana María A. quien inicio vendiendo unos cuantos productos como gaseosa, huevos, café, sal etc. que poco a poco fue surtiendo hasta tener una pulpería bien formada. Además realiza a sopa los fines de semanas por encargo. 
Sus compañeros de grupos son Socorro B. G. quien vende cosméticos y Patricia del Carmen Amador que es comerciante de ropa. Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus negocios.
texts.en:
The 'Hosana' group is made up three hardworking women, one of whom is Ana María A.. She began selling products including soft drinks, eggs, coffee and salt, which grew bit by bit until it became a general store. She also makes soup to order on the weekends. Her partners in the group are Socorro B. G., who sells cosmetics, and Patricia del Carmen Amador, who sells clothes. They will invest their loan in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Legumes, soft drink, bread, etc.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “PACAHA ILLARIY”; Nuestro socio vive en la comunidad de Llullucha,  distrito de Ocongate,  provincia de Quispicanchis departamento de Cusco.

Nuestro socio es él  Sr. Juan,  él socio tiene 33 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos, Nuestro socio  trabaja como albañil y en algunas ocasiones como porteador al camino inka y en el nevado de Ausangate, Nuestro socio trabaja mucho porque es el único sustento económico que su familia tiene; él socio disfruta lo que hace y está construyendo su casa para lo cual Solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción.

El soco agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the "PACAHA ILLARIY" community bank and lives in the community of Llullucha in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco. Our member, Sr. Juan, is 33 years old, partnered and has 4 children. He works as a construction worker and part-time porter for tourists along the Camino Inka and around Mt. Ausangate. He works long hours because that's the only way that he can support his family. He likes his work and is building a house. He is applying for a loan to buy construction materials for the house. The member is grateful for the help that this kind of lending provides and is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 47-year-old welder.  He primarily welds door frames, window frames, chairs, and beds.  He has been in this business for 10 years and has 3 employees.  James is married and has 8 children, from 12 to 20 years old. 

The primary business challenges he faces are fewer customers than he would like, clients with low incomes, and his high electricity bills.  Before his welding business, he worked in a battery-charging business.

James plans to use the 40,000 KES loan to purchase raw materials for his welding business (iron rods, wire and welding rods, hacksaw blades, etc.)
 
In the future, James hopes to be able to access more capital so he can sell finished products and open a workshop to teach others, especially orphans.  In 5 years, he dreams of employing more workers, expanding the workshop, and producing a wider variety of products.

James describes himself as hard-working, determined, honest, and patient.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his welding business

loans.name: San Pablo Group

texts.es:
Olga C. C. integrante de la Asociación Comunal San Pablo que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Santiago II, tiene 30 años y es vecina de la ciudad de El Alto, esta es la primera vez que trabaja con Pro Mujer ya que fue invitada por un funcionario de la institución. Olga se dedica a vender ropa hace 4 años con el apoyo de una amiga pudo sacar adelante su negocio que además le permite cuidar a su pequeño hijo. Ella tiene su puesto de venta en la Ceja, específicamente en la avenida Tihuanaku. Con el préstamo tiene planificado comprar más ropa y tener mayor clientela. Ella tiene el deseo estar por mucho tiempo con la familia de Pro Mujer.
Las demás integrantes de esta  Asociación tienen diversas actividades económicas del área de producción, servicio y comercio.
texts.en:
Olga C. C. is a member of the San Pablo Communal Association which in turn belongs to the Santiago II Center. She is 30 years old and lives near the city of El Alto. This is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer [For Women], having been invited by an official of the institution. Olga has worked for 4 years selling clothing. With the help of a friend she has been able to move ahead with her business while still being able to take care of her young son. She has a sales location in La Ceja [an area near El Alto], specifically on the Tihuanaku Avenue. With the loan she plans to buy more clothing and have a larger clientele. She wants to remain for a long time with the Pro Mujer family. The other members of this association have various economic activities in the areas of production, service, and commerce.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Help Friends Group

texts.en:
Edward M., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'Help Friends'. He is 45 years old, single, and has two children who are 5 and 28 years old. He is a college graduate.

For 14 years, he has been selling drugs in a pharmacy in the Amaghashie Community, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more drugs for his pharmacy. He describes himself as friendly. His dream is to improve his business and be able to extend his pharmacy to a clinic.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for his pharmacy.

loans.name: Esther

texts.fr:
Madame Esther C. est une femme mariée de 46 ans et mère de 7 enfants qui vit avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Ayant  abandonnée l’école, dès à son jeune âge, elle  commença tôt les activités génératrices de revenus. Pendant des années elle vendait des condiments alimentaires au marché, mais sans succès.
Elle décide alors de faire des achats et  vente de beurre de karité. 
Avec une expérience de plus de 8 ans Madame Esther C. maîtrise son activité. Elle s’approvisionne à Bougouni et dans les villages environnants. 
Elle a appris cette activité auprès de sa mère. 
Elle a fait la connaissance de Soro Yiriwaso à travers une association du quartier. 
Après 4 prêts solidaires, elle vient  au prêt individuel. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursé. 
Ainsi pour renforcer d’avantage son activité, elle continue de collaborer  avec Soro Yiriwaso et compte utiliser ce premier prêt individuel pour acheter du beurre de Karité en grande quantité.
Elle mène cette activité au marché de la ville, dans les marchés hebdomadaires et à la maison.  Sa clientèle est diverse et variée.
Elle compte réaliser,  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 48 500 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice elle envisage agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mrs. Esther C. is a married woman, 46 years of age, who is the mother of seven children. She lives with her husband and children in the Torakabougou district of Bougoni (the third administrative republic of Mali). Having left school at a young age, she started working and earning an income early on. For some years she used to sell food condiments at the market, but without much success. She then decided to trade in shea butter. After more than eight years in this line of business, Mrs. Esther C. knows her work well. She stocks up in Bougoni and in the nearby villages. She has learned this business from her mother. She was introduced to Soro Yirwaso thanks to a local association. After four solidarity loans, she has moved on to an individual loan. All previous loans have been properly repaid. In order to strengthen her business further, she continues to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso, and plans to use her first individual loan to purchase large quantities of shea butter. She sells at the town market, at the weekly markets and out of her home. Her customer base is diverse and varied. With this loan, she plans to achieve a monthly income of 48,500 West African Francs. She envisages expanding her business thanks to this income.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing shea butter

loans.name: Dante

texts.en: Dante C. is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City. He is 39 years old. Dante is married and has four school-aged children. Dante owns and operates a business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle taxi, or habal-habal, services to local community members. Dante has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Dante joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business. He has successfully repaid his last loan from HSPFI, which was for 8,000 PHP and was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Dante is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be his third from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Joseline Anahi

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN SONCCO ”; El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac,  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Joseline;  ella tiene 23  años de edad, es soltera; La socia se dedica a la atención de su bar, ella es empresaria y desde hace 4 años ha estado trabajando en diferentes negocios vendiendo diferentes artículos, cosméticos, dictado de clases para niños  y juntó un pequeño  capital, para invertirlo en el alquiler de un local y la implementación de su bar. La socia desea comprar copas, bebidas, velas y diferentes insumos para implementar el bar, ella también está postulando a la universidad le gustas las artes visuales.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en  la implementación de su bar.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Joseline belongs to the community bank "Hatun Soncco", which is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province of Cusco, in the state of Cusco. Joseline is 23 years old and is single. She dedicates herself to running a bar. She is a businesswoman and for four years she has worked in various businesses, selling various articles, cosmetics, and recordings of classes for children. In this way she was able to acquire a small amount of capital to invest in renting a space and starting up a bar. Joseline would like to buy glasses, drinks, candles, and various supplies to set up her bar. She is also applying for university and is interested in visual arts. Joseline is requesting this loan to invest in setting up her bar. She is thankful for and values the loan offered to her and promises to comply with the payment of her installments according to the timeline established.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in setting up her bar

loans.name: Unice

texts.en:
Unice is 57 years old and a member of Mumbuni Wa Mundu self-help group in Faulu Kenya. She joined the group as an entrepreneur who sells clothes, shoes and beauty salon products. She also does farming for extra income.

Unice appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping her to keep her business running. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES with which she will buy more beauty products, clothes and shoes.

Unice has five children, four above eighteen years and one still in school. She hopes to assist her children to be independent and to own plots or land for doing business.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products, clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
George W., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'God Is Able'.  He is 65 years old, married, and has nine children who are between the ages of 30 and 6 years old. He was only able to attend school through 9th grade due to financial constraints. 

For 4 years, he has been selling soap, oil, milk, onions, tomatoes, sugar, tea, butter, hair grease, etc. in 72nd Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 8,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 40,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more soap, oil, milk, onions, tomatoes, sugar, tea, butter, hair grease, etc. 

He describes himself as a dedicated man whose goal is to grow his business.

loans.use: To buy more soap, oil, milk, onions, tomatoes, sugar, tea, butter, hair grease, etc.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
Karen vive en casa de su hermana en la zona las lomas de la ciudad de La Paz, es madre soltera, tiene una niña de 5 años de edad; la actividad que realiza es la venta de pollos a la broaster en una tienda que funciona en su mismo domicilio. El crédito que solicita es para implementar su negocio, ya que fue heredado por su mama y necesita renovar los muebles, cocina y otros.

El negocio es su única fuente de ingresos, por lo tanto se sugiere otorgar el crédito, esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito.
texts.en:
Karen lives in her sister’s house in La Paz’s Las Lomas neighborhood.  She is a single mother of a five year old daughter.  She sells Broasted-style chicken in a store she runs at her home address.

The loan is to equip her business since she inherited it from her mother and she needs to refurbish furniture, stove and other items.

The business is her only source of income so granting the loan is advisable; this is the first time she has requested a loan.

loans.use: For costs to refurbish furniture, stove and other items in her broasted-style chicken sales business.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran is a resident of Khanewal which is located in Punjab and famous for its agriculture industry in Paksitan. She is 30 years old and married to M. A., who has a business of selling groceries. He runs a grocery shop in the nearby market where he sells different daily use items to his customers. He has a good number of clients. 

Sughran is a housewife, stays at home and takes care of her house and family. She is the mother of 6 sons. Unfortunately, none of them could get an education due to poor financial condition.  Her first two sons work in a private organization while the third son works in a general store. Sughran wants to secure her family’s future that’s why she wants improvement in her husband’s business. 

For this reason, she has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will stock more grocery items such as lentils, rice, cooking oil and spices etc in his shop. That will enable him in generating a good income from his business.   Sughran is confident that her husband’s business will be improved after making this investment. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit rating and never missed any  meeting.  

Note: “In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Sughran”.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Joram

texts.en:
Joram S. is forty years old from Khwisero and married to Linet. They have three children aged fifteen, ten and seven years old. 

Joram has a business of selling grains, most typically corn. He has been in this business for the past ten years and has grown a huge customer base over the years. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to purchase more corn to sell. He intends to use the profits to pay school fees for his children. 

His desire is to buy a piece of land and get into farming.

loans.use: To buy corn supplies to sell.

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo R. is from the town of Banga. He is 46 years old. Leo is married and has 2 children aged 10 and 17. Leo's wife is a teacher, while he is a farmer. He works hard to give his family everything they need. He tills his own land where he plants and harvests rice crops. He says he is hoping for the weather to cooperate so he will have a better yield. He plans to buy his own farm equipment soon.

Leo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leo is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Leo from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Juan Oswaldo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Juan; el tiene 41 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de industrialización de frutas como mermeladas,yogurt,compotas de diferentes frutas, el socio lleva ya unos años en este negocio en el cual trabaja con su pareja siendo esta la forma de sacar a sus hijos adelante.  

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio. 

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the loan group "MI PERU" ("My Peru"), located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

Juan, 41, lives with his partner and has one child. Alongside his daily tasks he runs a fruit processing business to produce jams, yogurt and various fruit compotes. He has been running it for a few years and he works alongside his partner. They do it to support their family. 

He is requesting the loan to purchase supplies for his business. He would like to thank those contributing to his dream through this and is committed to repaying it in the agreed terms.

loans.use: Loan requested to purchase supplies for his business.

loans.name: Amelia's Group

texts.en:
Amelia A. is from the village of Santo Domingo in Luna municipality, Isabela province. She is 49 years old. Amelia is the group leader of a four-member group applying for a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Amelia is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Amelia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Amelia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP when she sells one of her raised animals.

In 2008 Amelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22000 PHP from ASKI. Amelia is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Amelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a forty-year-old married female with three children, and she owns a house in Kasese. She has been in the pharmacy business for twenty years. Her vision is to turn her business into a clinic and to educate her children. Rebecca needs the loan to buy drugs for her shop.

loans.use: To buy medicines for resale.

loans.name: Sonia Esmeralda

texts.es:
Doña Sonia Esmeralda S. G., es trabajadora de la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua (UNAN, dese4mpeñándo el cargo de Aseadora del Departamento de Psicología, desde diciembre del 2001.
Este es el tercer crédito, este es el tercer crédito que trabaja en CEPRODEL, y lo necesita para mejora de vivienda.
Agradece a CEPRODEL por haberle otorgado estos créditos ya que le ayudan a mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Doña Sonia works for the National Independent University of Nicaragua (UNAN). She has been working as a housekeeper in the Psychology Department since Dec. 2001. This is her third loan with CEPRODEL. She will use it to improve her house. She is thankful to CEPRODEL, who has allowed her to apply for these loans and has helped her improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To repair her house and other personal expenses.

loans.name: Dédé Amivi

texts.fr: Dame Amivi est mariée et a 32 ans. Elle a un enfant  en sa  charge. Elle est coiffeuse de profession Pour pouvoir contribuer au menage, mais elle a associé  la vente de mèches et les achète  au grand marché de Lomé. Elle compte 3 ans dans cette activité et revend les mèches dans un salon de coiffure  sur la route Lapampa.  Elle demande un prêt pour acheter 5 douzaines de Tissage Noble et 5 douzaines de mèche Nina. La dame est habillée  en tissus pagne
texts.en: Dédé Amivi  is 32 years old, married, and has a child entrusted to her care. She is a hairdresser by profession To contribute to  household expenses, she also sells hair extensions that she buys at the Lomé Grand Market.  She has operated this business for 3 years and sells the hair pieces in a hair salon on the La Pampa Road . She is requesting a loan to buy 5 dozen Tissage Noble and 5 dozen Nina hair extensions. She is dressed in pagne fabric.

loans.use: To buy hair extensions

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn E. is from the village of Nagassican, Santiago City. She is 38 years old. Marlyn is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Marlyn owns & operates a business selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling plasticware and kitchenware. Marlyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Marlyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI. That loan was used to purchase products to sell.
