Marlyn is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Marlyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her  business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de chaussures, de charbon de bois, de tiéké, de savons et d’habillements.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des chaussures, des habits, des savons, du tiéké et du charbon de bois.                                                                         
Korotoumou C. compte acheter des chaussures avec les grossistes du marché de Dioïla, hebdomadairement. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place à la maison et au marché, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10.000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Danaya group are all married 32 year olds with three children each. They all live in traditional extended families in a town called Dioïla, located in the municipality of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region (the second largest region of the Republic of Mali).
They met through family and friendship ties. They sell shoes, firewood, soap and clothes. 
The women are on their sixth loan which they will use to purchase shoes, dresses, soaps and firewood.                                                              
Korotoumou C. aims to purchase shoes from wholesalers at the Dioïla market every week.  She will sell her goods every day from home and at the market, for cash or credit and to a customer base made up of men and women.
She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA which will be used to pay back her loan, to pay for social ceremonies and some will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: Purchasing shoes

loans.name: Kokou Jean Martin

texts.fr: Monsieur Martin  est marié et a 5 enfants. Il a 36 ans. Il a reçu de Wages un crédit qu’il a parfaitement remboursé. Il est Cameraman et Reporteur. Il a débuté cette activité en 1998 et à le siège de son activité à ablogamé à côté de la pharmacie des oliviers. Il s’approvisionne à la société NEACOMPS. Il sollicite un prêt pour acheter un ordinateur et une photocopieuse.
texts.en: Mr. Martin is married and has 5 children.  He is 36 years old.  He received a loan from WAGES, which he paid back in full.  He is a cameraman and reporter.  He began this job in 1998 and his business is based in Ablogamé, next to the Olive Trees Pharmacy.  He gets his supplies from the company Neacomps.  He is asking for a loan to buy a computer and a photocopier.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and photocopier

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanny C. (pictured at home) and her husband, Mr. Thorn Som, have been married since 1977. They have six children – three sons and three daughters. The family lives in a village across the Mekong River, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 
Vanny and her husband are sugar cane farmers. Vanny is asking for another loan of $1,200 to purchase a sugar cane juicing machine and a motorbike for her son to carry sugar cane juice for sale.

loans.use: to purchase a sugar cane juicing machine and a motorbike for her son to carry sugar cane juice for sale

loans.name: María Elva

texts.es:
La Sra. María Elva es soltera, tiene  cinco  hijos, de los cuales  dos están en edad escolar y tres son mayores de edad que viven todavía con ella.
María se dedica a la venta de ropas, en forma ambulante, la misma actividad le genera un buen ingreso.
Con la ayuda de sus hijos están saliendo adelante, con mucho sacrificio y dedicación, ya que sólo ellos mismos son el poyo familiar y económico que necesitan.
Hoy día ella es una microempresaria exitosa con  mucha  clientela, debido a su buen trato.
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos por lo que se anima a solicitar todo el apoyo necesario para mejorar sus mercaderías, desea invertir el crédito en la compra de abrigos y pantalones.
texts.en:
María Elva is single and has five children.  Two of her children are in school and three are grown up but still live with her.

María sells clothes in an itinerant manner.  This makes her a good income.

With the help of her children, María's family is getting ahead in life.  They make a lot of sacrifice and commitment as they themselves are their only source of financial support.

María is a successful small businesswoman who has a lot of customers because of her good customer service.  She has proven herself to be a responsible and honest person and she is requesting all the support she needs in order to improve her merchandise.  She would like to invest her loan in buying coats and pants.

loans.use: to buy coats and pants

loans.name: Progreso 2011 Group

texts.es:
Hilaria, 46 años de edad, casada, 3 hijas. Presidenta de la alcancìa comunal: "Progreso 2011".
Hilaria con su esposo Oscar que es carpintero, tienen una carpinterìa desde hace 7 años. Adicionalmente a este negocio venden comida en ferias.
Hiñaria tiene 3 hijas y sòlo Rocio de 13 años depende de ellos. 
El prèstamo otorgado es para la compra de maderas para poder cumplir con sus pedidos de puertas.
En la fotografìa Hilaria esta vestida con chompa rojo y pantalòn marròn y es la primera de la derecha.
texts.en:
Hilaria, age 46, is married with 3 daughters. She is rhe president of the "Progreso 2011" communal bank.

Hilaria, along with her husband Oscar who is a carpenter, have operated a carpentry shop for 7 years. In addition to this business, they sell food at open-air markets.

Hilaria has three daughters, and only Rocio, age 13, is dependent on her.  

The loan offered to her is to buy wood in order to fulfill orders for doors. 

In the photograph, Hilaria is wearing a red sweater and brown pants, and she is the first on the right.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Hesle

texts.en: Hesle is 43 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family by running a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy assorted goods for her store. Hesle has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her store for two years and also earns income from raising goats. Hesle aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods for her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en: Hasmik is from the village of Hovouny in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with two children – a twenty-four-year-old daughter and a twenty-seven-year-old son.  Hasmik has a high school education and has been a private farmer for the past sixteen years.  In her village of Hovouny, she has many relatives and close friends.  Hasmik enjoys the fresh air and working the land.  In addition to her farming business, she helps her married daughter’s family with produce grown on her farm.  Hasmik would like a loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer.  According to her business plan, this investment will increase the family income by ten percent.  She will save some of the proceeds to remodel the family home.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Saira Eveling

texts.es:
Saira Eveñing tiene 21 años, es casada vive con el esposo no tienen hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama UNIDOS VENCEREMOS,	 se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto La América, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Saira se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace mucho tiempo. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos y la variación del clima. Su sueño es tener casa y comprar una finca para seguir sembrando.

Le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Saira Eveling is 21 years old, married, and lives with her husband.  They do not have any children.  They live in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

This community bank is called "Unidos Venceremos" (United We Shall Overcome).  It is located in La América, in Ventanas canton.  The members of the bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Saira grows crops, especially corn and rice.  She has been doing this for a long time.  She makes her purchases in Ventanas each month and makes her sales in the market in the same town.

Saira is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her work such as pest infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to own her own home and to buy a farm so that she can continue growing her crops.

Saira enjoys playing indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and manure

loans.name: Virgilo

texts.en:
Virgilio, 40 years old, married and he and his wife were blessed with four children. He's been growing corn for almost 18 years. His net income last planting season was 20,000 PHP. 

He's asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his corn farm. He hopes to continue to access loans and achieve his dream for his children through patience and hard work.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his corn farm.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. 
Michael provides motorela, or habal-habal services, while his wife manages their retail store selling snacks. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy tools & to pay for utilities needed to provide his service.
Michael has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Michael hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for utilities needed to provide his service

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 3 children. Elvira has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Elvira has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Elvira hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Israel

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, tem 29 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, fez 7ª classe não deu continuidade devido a falta de condições Financeiras. É pai de 2 filhos de 5 e 9 anos, o mais velho é que vai a Escola. Vive na casa própria com sua familia não responsabiliza se por ninguem.

Actualmente trabalha  e reside no Distrito de Namaacha e é funcionario permante ha mais de 2 anos na Empresa Agua da auferindo mensalmente 4.200.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da sua obra.  

Nunca  trabalhou com outros Bancos  alêm da Hluvuku, este é seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção nomeadamente( cimento, areia e blocos) para dar continuidade da obra DE CONSTRUCAO DA SUA CASA. Esta disposto a pagar antes do tempo para aceder a outros créditos.
texts.en:
Israel was born in Namaacha District. He is 29 years old and is married. He finished seventh grade but did not continue school because of financial problems. Israel has two children, ages five and nine; the eldest goes to school. He lives in his own house with his family and does not support anyone else.

Israel currently lives and works in Namaacha District. He has been a permanent employee at the water company for more than two years, earning 4,200 meticais per month. He uses the money for household expenses and his construction project.

He has never worked with other banks besides Hluvuku. This is his first loan, and he is asking for 10,000 meticais to buy construction materials, namely cement, sand, and blocks, to continue with his housing project. He is willing to pay off the loan ahead of time so he will be able to get other loans.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, namely cement, sand and blocks.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu is a 46-year-old lady who lives in the Sinkor area. She is married and her husband is a pensioned government worker. They have six children between the ages of 2 and 23, and all of them live at home.

For the past four years she has been selling used clothing in the local market. Sometimes she makes less money but most of the time she has good daily sales. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase two barrels of used clothes for her business. She plans to build a house for her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase two barrels of used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 34 years old and lives in the town of Arua hill in the Luweero region of Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Alice has a business of a small hotel that sells food.   She has had this business for 6 years.         

To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase food for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Alice hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, Alice hopes to expand her business.     Alice is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business and her capital.

loans.use: to purchase food for resale.

loans.name: Yauson Armando

texts.es:
Yauson Armando tiene 41 años de edad, es soltero no tiene hijos vive solo,  en el Canton Chillanes Provincia de Bolivar.

La V.R.C se llama EL PLACER perteneciente al Canton Chillanes parroquia San Jose del Tambo esta ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina, en esta ventanilla hay 24 socios que se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de Platano, arroz, yuca, cacao, soya y naranja ademas crian animales de corral.

Yauson  se dedica a la siembra de arroz, maiz, naranja, soya y platano. Las compras las realiza en San Jose del Tambo y las Vende en el mercado de Chillanes los domingos en la feria.

El credito lo solicita para comprar de insumos agricolas y fertilizantes. El credito le ayudara como apoyo para mejorar la cosecha. No enfrenta desafios importantes. Su sueño es tener casa propia y un vehiculo.

En los tiempos libres le gusta ir de paseo con los padres que estan viejitos.
texts.en:
Yauson Armando is 41 and single.  He doesn't have children and lives alone in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar.

This communal bank is called, "El Placer," and belongs to the canton of Chillanes in the parish of San José del Tambo.  It is 60 minutes from the office.  This branch has 24 members that make a living through agriculture and grow plantains, rice, yucca, cacao, soy, and oranges.  They also raise poultry.

Yauson grows rice, corn, oranges, soy, and plantains.  He buys his supplies in San Jose del Tambo and sells his crops in the market in Chillanes on Sundays.

He is requesting this credit to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers.  The credit will help him as support to improve his harvest.  He is not facing any important challenges.  His dream is to have his own home and a vehicle.

In his free time, he likes to take trips with his parents, who are elderly.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a machine to make snow cones.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 29-year-old man. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Rami has a store for selling generators. He wants to improve his store and increase his sales. He hopes to increase his income by purchasing more generators to sell. However, the amount of money he has isn't enough, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Rami gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to purchase more generators for sale and have a better collection for sale. This will increase his income and provide him with better life conditions. Rami is photographed in his store.


About this loan product:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase more generators for sale.

loans.name: Monette

texts.en:
Monette is 25 years old. She is married and has two children. 

Monette has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Monette has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Monette hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her store

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 39 year old a married woman who has five children, all of them in school. She has a business of selling clothes in Kator, South Sudan.
Anna requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes for sale. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOQ ALLPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana; ella tiene 42 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de repuestos de carro, ella vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,ella vende llantas,motores,luces entre otros repuestos, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de repuestos de carro. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos de carro al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “MOSOQ ALLPA”. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Sra. Ana. She is 42 years old, married with 4 children. The member divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling car parts which she does from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.. She sells tyres, motors, lights and other spare parts. By means of this business the member takes care of her children. The member wants to expand and improve the business of selling spare parts for cars. The member is asking for a loan to buy car spare parts wholesale.

The member is happy for the loan and agrees to make the repayments.

loans.use: to buy car spare parts wholesale.

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.ru: Абдулло вдовец и в воспитании имеет одного сына. Он хочет содержит своего сына в хороших условиях и хочет чтобы он стал образованным и воспитанным человекам. Более одного года он занимается скотоводством. Он имеет 3 голов крупного рогатого скота и 2 голов мелко рогатого скота. Он имеет хорошую условию на содержание скота. Также имеет на запас 200 шт. пресса и 300 кг пшеницу, чтобы откармливать их в зиме. Абдулло запрашивает займ для покупки 2 голов крупного рогатого скота и 2 голов мелко рогатого скота с целью расширения бизнеса. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен всем вам.
texts.en: Abdullo is a widower and is bringing up one son. He wants to support his son with a good education and wants him to become an educated and well-mannered man. For more than a year, he has been breeding cattle. He has 3 cattle and 2 sheep. He has good conditions to raise his cattle. As such, he has in stock a 200-piece combine and 300 kilograms of wheat to fatten them for the winter. Abdullo is requesting a loan to purchase 2 cattle and 2 sheep to grow his business. He looks forward to your help and thanks you all in advance.

loans.use: purchase cattle

loans.name: Sylvestre

texts.en: Sylvestre is 38 years old, married, and has six children between the ages of 5 and 18. He sells goods such as  beans, maize, etc. He has ten years of experience in his business and works from 7 a.m until 9 p.m every day except Saturday. Sylvestre currently employs three people to help him. Sylvestre has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand the inventory of his goods (beans, sorghum, and maize). With the profits, Sylvestre will reinvest in his business, pay school fees for his children, and save for his future.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of sorghum and beans.

loans.name: Zoure Group

texts.fr:
Mme KISWENDSIDA RACHEL  est la représentante du groupe ZOURE. Elle est  divorcée  et mère de 06enfants. Le plus âgé  a 21ans et  le moins âgé a 04ans. 05 vont  à l’école. Elle a 03 personnes  en charge.

Elle vend divers marchandises (arachides, galettes, bonbon et haricots) depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au  marché de Napougo en ville. Ses clients sont  les femmes et hommes.

Elle veut  s’acheter  05 plats d’haricots, 05 plats de petit mil, 01kg de sucre et 01 litre d’huile.

 Mme épargne  ses bénéfices pour ajouter d’autres produits. Elle ambitionne  aider ses enfants à aller loin dans leur étude à travers la scolarité.
texts.en:
Kiswindsida Rachel is the representative of the group Zoure. She is divorced and the mother of six children. The oldest is 21 years old and the youngest is four. Five of the children are in school. Kiswindsida Rachel supports another three people.

She has been selling various food goods (groundnuts, pancakes, sweets and beans) for five years. She buys her supplies at the Napougo market in town. Her customers are men and women.

She wants to buy 5 bowls of beans, 5 bowls of pearl millet, 1 kg of sugar and 1 litre of oil.

Kiswindsida Rachel saves her profits to buy other products. Her ambition is to help her children succeed in their studies through attending school.

loans.use: to buy 5 bowls of beans, 5 bowls of pearl millet, 1 kg of sugar and 1 litre of oil.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 41 years old and married to John. They have three children.

She has been into the business for the last two years. She earns a monthly income of KES 20,000 from her business. She is applying for her first loan of KES 10,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the funds to buy more knitting wool, textile fabrics and to buy another knitting machine in the future.

loans.use: To buy knitting wool and textiles/fabrics

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is 46 years old. She is married and has two children. Her son has a vegetable-selling business, and her daughter is an embroidery expert. 

Allah Rakhi also does work. She is a sewing expert and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She has great interest in her work. She tries to learn new things in sewing and sews good-looking clothes at reasonable rates. 

Allah Rakhi has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who operates a grocery store business. With the loan investment, he will buy grocery stock such as spices, sugar, cooking oil, etc. in bulk quantity, which will allow him to fulfill client orders on time and increase his profits. 

Allah Rakhi has a lot of confidence in her husband.  She believes he will make good use of the loan money and earn good profits as a result.

loans.use: To buy grocery stock for her husband's grocery store business.

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina is 39 years old and is married to Mutiso. They have two children. She has been a dairy farmer for the past 3 years, earning a monthly income of Kes 8,600.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 20,000. She will use the funds to purchase dairy feeds (molasses, hay and Napier grass) for her cows. With the anticipated profits, she will improve her family's living standards.

Her hopes and dreams are to improve the quality of breeds for her dairy cattle and to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase dairy feeds

loans.name: Artyom

texts.en:
Artyom is married and lives with his wife and parents. He is an agronomist from Bazum village of Lori region. His father is an army officer and Artyom runs a farm. For sustaining his family's living, he works hard to run agriculture in a sustainable way ensuring a stable income every month. He keeps livestock of pigs, piglets, and turkeys. He sells milk and meat to local wholesalers.

Artyom requested a loan, which he will use to enlarge his farm. He plans to purchase four calves and forage for the livestock. Artyom has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, he was not able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that his agribusiness is successful and he is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Artyom has been approved for this loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to purchase four calves and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Ayitcheme 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement AYITCHEME 2 est formé de dix personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupement, nommée Rose, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupement sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Rose est âgée de 42 ans et est mariée à un certain Euloge. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés, dont quatre à leur charge. Rose vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour y arriver, Rose vend des chaussures dans sa région depuis dix ans. A côté de cette activité qui lui permet de contribuer aux divers besoins du ménage, Rose vend également du pain sucré. Rose s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’accroître le niveau de son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Rose désire obtenir un troisième financement, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement AYITCHEME 2. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group called Ayitcheme 2 is made up of 10 persons who live in the same district. Rose, the representative of this group,  is the one who is raising her hand in the photo. This is the third time that this group has requested a loan from ALIDé in order to raise the level of their businesses. 

Rose is 42 and married to Euloge. The couple have five children, all in school, of whom four are their dependents. Rose lives with her husband and children. The couple share in covering the expenses of the household. In order to do that, Rose has been selling shoes in her area for 10 years. Besides this activity which allows her to contribute to supporting the household, Rose also sells sugared bread. She buys her supplies in a market in Benin. 

Wishing to grow her business and better respond to the needs of her clientele, Rose would like to request a third loan, together with the other members of her group called Ayitcheme 2. Their previous loans have been correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy shoes and sugared bread

loans.name: Sayra

texts.en: My name is Sayra G. I work producing and selling tortillas and patties, I have my business for about 4 years, my business is located near by a national soccer team and my clients are really good, my business produces income to support my family. My goal is to increase my inventory to increase my sales an be able to have a better variety of food and feed my new born child.

loans.use: To buy corn flour, lime, salt, water, wood, coal, ground meat, spices, butter.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.en:
My name is Maria Antonia, and I am a widowed mother of 3. Recently I lost my husband to an accident. This has forced me to seek a way of life in which I can sustain my family. I prepare food during the afternoons and weekends and work during the morning hours cleaning a company's office. At this time I need to strengthen my business now that I do not have any help and my children are attending school. I am an optimistic woman, and through my efforts I can further provide for my family's future.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Maria Antonia, tengo 3 hijos y soy viuda, recientemente perdi a mi esposo en un accidente lo que me ha hecho buscar la manera de mantener a mi familia, me dedico a preparar comidas por las tardes y fines de semana, tambien trabajo en horas de la manana en una empresa que me paga por el aseo de su local, ahora necesito fortalecer mas mi negocio ya que no tengo ayuda de nadie, y mis hijos se encuentran en la escuela. Soy una mujer optimista y se que poninedo de mi esfuerzo puedo sacar adelante a mi familia.

loans.use: Purchase seasonings, potatoes, meat, tortillas, beans, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
"I'm very worried about my family's safety because I work the night shift and my wife and son stay home alone. I would like to install a fence with bars around my home." I am asking for a $1,000.00 loan so that I can build this fence with bars.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

“Me preocupa mucho la seguridad de mi familia ya que mi trabajo es en el turno de noche y mi esposa y mi hijo se quedan solos, me gustaría cerrar mi casa con una barda y rejas al frente”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para la construcción de una barda y poner rejas.

loans.use: Build a fence with bars

loans.name: Crescencia

texts.es:
Mrs. Crescencia Núñez is 37 years old and single with 2 children, aged 19 and 12. The oldest now has his own business while the younger child is still in school.

Crescencia is a professional hairdresser who has been working in the business for 22 years. She started her career as an assistant in a very well known beauty salon in the capital, but once she had saved enough money she opened her own beauty salon in her home. Thanks to her excellent skills, she was able to grow a client following and these days a large number of clients come exclusively to her beauty shop, wanting only Crescencia to do their hair.

Her clientele is made up of people from her neighborhood and folks who have been recommended by her clients. When a client isn't able to come to her salon, Crescencia works in the client's home because she wants to give her clients excellent service. As a result, she does not have a fixed work schedule since although she closes at 7 PM, she remains available after hours or clients who need only call her cell phone to arrange an immediate appointment.

She needs the support of a loan to be able to buy more materials for her beauty salon. Her clients are quite demanding and she wants to keep herself up to date with the latest cuts and styles. To do so she is obliged to update her products and her tools.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Crescencia Núñez tiene 37 años, es soltera y tiene dos hijos de edades 19 y 12. El mayor ya se dedica a su propio negocio como comerciante y el menor aún está en el colegio estudiando.

La Señora es una peluquera profesional y hace 22 años que trabaja como tal. En un comienzo empezó trabajando como ayudante en un muy renombrado salón de belleza de la capital, pero luego de haber ahorrado suficiente dinero optó por abrir su propia peluquería en su casa. Gracias a su excelente habilidad, ella pudo ir formándose de clientela, y hoy día cuenta con un gran número de personas que acuden a su peluquería exclusivamente para que ella los atienda.

Su clientela está compuesta por intermedio de vecinos y recomendaciones de sus previos clientes. Cuando un cliente no puede ir a su local, ella realiza sus trabajos a domicilio, pues ella quiere dar la mayor comodidad posible a sus clientes. Es por esta razón que ella no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo ya que a pesar de cerrar cerca de las 7 de la tarde, ella aún está disponible y a distancia de un simple llamado a su celular.

Requiere del apoyo del crédito para así poder comprar más materiales para su peluquería pues como sus clientes son bastante exigentes, ella desea mantenerse al tanto de las últimas novedades en cortes y peinados; por lo que debe actualizar sus productos y utensilios

loans.use: Buy new products including hair color, creams, shampoo, bleaching agents, conditioners y nourishing hair treatments

loans.name: Ni Wayan Sulastri

texts.id:
Wayan Sulastri has a firewood selling business. With a capital of Rp1000,000 (about US$110), Wayan Sulastri bought firewood from her customers about 700 bundles at a price of Rp500 (about 60 cents) per bundle. Then she sold to her customers at Rp600 (about 70 cents) per bundle. Her profit is Rp100 (11 cents)/bundle. Every day Wayan Sulastri could profit up to Rp70,000 (about $7.70). Serving her customers from home, Wayan Sulastri could also nurse her husband Bapak Nengah Wandra , who is ill with stroke. Every day living expense is Rp20,000 (about $2.20) plus child expense. With this business Wayan Sulastri is the backbone of the family, to provide for her sick husband. Loan from Dinari will be used to buy more firewood, with the hope that adding her sales would bring more profit for family better living.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Wayan Sulastri mempunyai usaha jual beli kayu bakar. Dengan modal Rp.1.000.000,- Wayan Sulastri membeli kayu api dari langganannya kurang lebih 700 ikat dengan harga perikat Rp.500,-. Sedangkan Wayan Sulastri menjual ke langganannya Rp.600. perikat. Keuntungannya Rp. 100,- perikat . Perharinya Wayan Sulastri bisa mendapat untung sampai Rp. 70.000,- .Dengan menunggu langganannya di rumah Wayan Sulastri juga bisa merawat suaminya Bapak Nengah Wandra yang sedang sakit struk. Biaya hidupnya sehari-hari Rp 20.000,- ditambah lagi biaya untuk anaknya. Dengan usahanya ini Wayan Sulastri menjadi tulang punggung keluarga dan menghidupi suaminya yang sakit.. Pinjaman dari Dinari digunakan untuk menambah pembelian kayu Bakar dan diharapkan dapat menambah barang dagangannya agar keuntungan yang diperoleh bisa meningkat untuk kesejahteraan keluarganya.

loans.use: Buy firewood from firewood collectors, and sell to processor

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sorn C. was married in 1979 and now has 9 children, 4 sons and 5 daughters. Since she was married she has run her own business, planting and selling vegetables. Her husband is a construction contractor. When he is free from the construction work he also assists his wife in planting vegetables. With these businesses they can earn enough money to send their children to attend school. Six of their children are living under their custody and are studying at school. The remaining three children were married and moved to live in different houses.      

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA twice before. Now she is asking a loan of $1,200. She will use this loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and a covering net.

loans.use: to purchase ertilizer, pesticide and covering net.

loans.name: Isabel Joaquim

texts.pt:
Isabel Joaquim G. is a resident of the Maxaquene district. She is 47 years old and has 5 children. She is married and has her business in her home. She is a seamstress and makes clothing for children. She is entering the program and asking for $225US for 4 months. She is going to invest the money in her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Isabel Joaquim G. , portadora de BI nº110129024X ,residente do bairro da Maxaquene, de 47 anos de idade tem 5 filhos vive maritalmente tem o seu negocio em casa ,é modista faz roupa para crianças esta a entrar no programa e vai tomar 5000 para pagar em 4 meses o dinheiro ela vai investir no negocio.

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Sunheang

texts.en:
Mrs. L. Sunheang (age 42) and her husband have been married since 1989.They have four children—three sons and one daughter. One of her daughters is weaving silk at home and the other three children are studying at a local school. Sunheang and her family are living on an island of Mekong River. She is in the business of weaving silk.  She learned to weave silk from her neighbor and started her silk production in 1987. Her husband also works as a silk weaver which he has done since 1994.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA six times already. Now she is requesting another loan for $350. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials, sewing thread and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
O. Nigora is 31-years-old and lives in the J.Rasulov region of Tajikistan. She is married and has two children. Mrs.O. is engaged in the business of making and selling “lepeshky” (the national bread). She is also the accountant in the Jamoat.

Mrs.O. is requesting a loan of $825 to purchase flour for her bread.

loans.use: To purchase flour for making bread

loans.name: Rubén

texts.es:
Ruben is a person with dreams of self-improvement. The studies he completed successfuly have granted him the possibility to help support his beloved parents. He works every day in a small lab that he has rented to provide his services. And due to his expenses he has not been able to make any improvements to his office, nor the equipment he uses for his work. For this reason he has decided to remodel a space in his house so that he might be able to relocate his lab there, thereby improving his workspace and the services he provides. Your support is very important and it will help him acquire the tools that he needs and to remodel the space in his house to be more welcoming.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Rubén, es una persona con muchos deseos de superación, la carrera que culminó con éxito le ha dado la posibilidad de contribuir con sus amorosos padres. Se desempeña a diario en un pequeño taller que ha alquilado para prestar sus servicios y debido al costo del arrendamiento no ha podido mejorar este espacio ni las herramientas que utiliza para su trabajo; por este motivo ha decidido acondicionar un espacio en su domicilio a fin de mudar su taller con el objetivo de mejorar sus instalaciones y servicio.Tu importante aporte servirá para adquirir las herramientas que le hacen falta y para otorgarle un ambiente acogedor a este pequeño nuevo taller.

loans.use: To purchase tools and equipment.

loans.name: Mwanahamis's Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Mwanahamis is 28 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 8 and 4 years old. Mwanahamis has a small business of making and selling chapatis that she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 9am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $30 from her sales.

In the past, Mwanahamis has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her chapati business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items such as flour, sugar, and oil for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Asha, Rehema and Nyeshi, who also have small businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more food items in order to make more chapatis

loans.name: Yan Seang Group

texts.en: Mrs. Yan S., the group leader, is a mat maker in Prek Rang Village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a widow without any children and has a reputation for being hard working. Business is booming, and she now needs a loan to buy more raw materials (i.e. palm leaves) to make enough mats to satisfy rising demand.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials to make mats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk to retail in her community.

loans.name: Yoly

texts.es:
Yola is a young 26 year old mother, who together with her husband fights to consolidate her family’s well-being. Yoly is the mother of two small children: one aged 7 and the other who is in fact yet to arrive: at the moment she’s still pregnant and she and her husband are waiting with much love for the baby’s arrival. Throughout all this, her husband is a great support in heavy physical tasks: his daily work consists of caring for their stable and their cows, which provide an income from the sale of the milk they produce. Every day, Yoly takes the cows to open spaces full of vegetation in order that they can feed themselves, and then later hers them back to the stable. This couple have suggested building-up a stable with a larger quantity of milk cows of better stock. And thus, the loan that they are asking for is to buy a milk cow from good stock. With a better quality of milk to sell, and with your help, this couple, their son and their future baby will have a better quality of life. Please, help them.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Yoly es una joven madre de familia de 26 años, que junto a su esposo, luchan por consolidar el bienestar de su familia. Yoly es madre de 2 pequeños; uno de 7 años y otro que está por llegar, ya que actualmente, está embarazada, ella y su esposo esperan con mucho amor a su bebe. Mientras tanto su esposo es un gran apoyo en las actividades de mayor esfuerzo físico, su trabajo diario consiste en cuidar de su establo y de sus vacas, las cuales generan ingresos económicos al vender la leche que producen. Cada día, Yoly se lleva a sus vacas a espacios abiertos llenos de vegetación para que se alimenten, y luego las regresa al establo. Esta pareja de esposos se ha propuesto tener un establo con mayor cantidad de vacas lecheras de mejor raza. Y justamente el préstamo que piden es para comprar una vaca lechera de buena raza, que de mejor calidad de leche para la venta, con tu ayuda esta pareja, su hijo y su futuro bebé tendrán una mejor calidad de vida. Apóyalos.

loans.use: To acquire a milk cow from good stock in order to improve the quality of the milk she produces.

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Mr. Leang L., 38, and his wife, Mrs. Dy Choen, 35, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1990 and have six sons. One of their sons is a wooden house worker. Three of their sons are in local school.

Leang is a truck driver. He carries goods and other materials from one province to another province. His wife has been selling grocery items for ten years. She buys them from a market in Phnom Penh for resale at her shop in the village. Recently Leang's truck broke and they lack the money to fix it so that he can continue his business. So, Leang is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 to repair his truck.

loans.use: To repair his truck.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata Kanté, 44 ans, mariée avec 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Kounkané 3 depuis 2 ans et demi. Elle vend de la glace, des crèmes glacées et de la banane. Elle veut renforcer son commerce en achetant des sacs de pain de singe, de bissap et de sucre pour faire des crèmes glacées et de la banane à revendre.  <b>Fatoumata sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Fatoumata Kanté, age 44, is married and has three children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Kounkané 3 for two and half years. She sells ice, ice cream, and bananas. She wants to bolster her business by buying bags of monkey bread (the fruit of the baobab tree), bissap (hibiscus flowers), sugar to make ice cream, and bananas to resell. Fatoumata is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell ice, ice cream, and bananas

loans.name: Lona

texts.en:
Lona F. is 55 years old and is married with seven children. She has four years of experience in the retail shop business. She sells to the publc and villagers seven days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (about 208 USD).  SPBD loans are Lona's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Lona indicates that even though there are many shops in her village, she wishes to attract more customers than others because she believes she offers the best customer service to her clients. Lona also wants to expand her shop. For these reasons, she wants to buy cement and other materials for business expansion as well as buy stock for her business.

loans.use: Purchase snacks e.g bongos,twities,chips lollies pubble gums, mutton flaps ,box of chicken,noodles, rice, sugar, flour, salt ,herrings,Cement,iron roofing ,timber,weelbarrow.

loans.name: Roselfina

texts.es: Roselfina tiene 28 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Trabaja cada día al cuidado de sus hijos y también en las tareas del campo, es una emergente agricultora y ganadera, pues tiene vacas, las cuales todas las mañanas sin excepción está al cuidado de ellas, de su alimentación, para que en el día que las venda tenga una considerable  ganancia porque le han costando mucho esfuerzo, al día puede extraer de 10 a 12 litros de leche, que le sirve para venderla, también trabaja en el cuidado de sus tierras de cultivo, en esta ocasión, cuida de sus pastizales de alfalfa, ya que es lo indispensable para la alimentación de sus animales y también tiene una granja de cuyes que va en aumento.  Roselfina trabaja diariamente motivada por el bienestar de su familia a la que quiere tanto. Invertirá el dinero prestado para techar parte de su casa que servirá como establo para sus vacas, también para comprar galpones para su granja de cuyes y comprar cuyes machos reproductores para mejorar la raza.
texts.en:
Roselfina is 28-years old and lives with her husband and 3 children. She works each day to care for her children and also works the farmland. She is an emerging livestock and agricultural farmer. She has cows which every morning, without exception, she cares for and ensures they are fed. For what they can sell there is considerable profit, but it also requires an extensive amount of effort. A day can draw about 10 to 12 litres of milk that can be sold.

Roselfina also tends to the alfalfa pastures, which is indispensable as it provides feed for the livestock of the farm. In addition to this, she also raises guinea pigs. Roselfina works daily with the motivation for the welfare of her family.

These borrowed funds would be put towards building an extension of the roof for the house that would act as a stable for her cows. Also, she will purchase a shed for her guinea pigs as well as a stud guinea pig for breeding purposes.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve the infrastructure of her stable and purchase guinea pigs for breding.

loans.name: Francisco Manuel

texts.es: El Sr. Francisco tiene 46 años de edad habitante de loma memorial Sandino, de la ciudad de Managua, es casado y concibió dos adorados hijas de 3 y 16 años de edad, las dos están estudiando en una escuela del barrio. Trabaja de sol a sol con su esposa en la venta de frutas y verduras en la camioneta ambulantemente por la calle de Managua desde hace 15 años. Sus planes son tener un negocio grande y fuerte en la venta de productos frescos de buena calidad. Por medio de los préstamos de Afodenic lograra aumentar sus ventas y a la vez sus ingresos y nivel de vida. Así también terminara la constricción de su casa.
texts.en:
Francisco is 46 years old and lives in the Loma Memorial Sandino district of Managua. He is married and has two beloved daughters of 3 and 16 years, both of whom attend a school in the neighbourhood. He works from dawn to dusk with his wife selling fruits and vegetables from their van on the streets of Managua, as he has done since he was 15 years old. He plans to have a strong business selling fresh, high-quality products. Through his loans from Kiva partner Afodeniche will be able to increase his sales as well as his income and his quality of life. This will also allow him to finish building his house.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fruit and vegetables to increase sales

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba J. is 50 years old, married and the mother of five kids; three of whom have successfully completed high school and are waiting for their results to enter the university, while the others are still in school. She has been a food vendor for twenty years through which she has supported her kids in school. She prepares and sells rice with stew and cooked yam in Ejura, a farming community where she lives with her household, and, along with this business, she also sells raw food products like maize in the marketplace of Ejura mostly during their market hours on Mondays. 

The food that Abiba prepares is a delicacy that many Ghanaians enjoy everyday either as breakfast, lunch or dinner, especially where she lives. Her business is doing well and she wants to expand her operations to serve more customers. With the loan, she wants to buy more maize grains, vegetables, yam, rice and assorted meat for her operation and also to use part to provide education for her kids. 

She hopes this loan will help to increase her savings and improve her family's well-being. She would be very grateful for that assistance. 

She belongs to the community group called ‘Rely on God’ Trust Group. Members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy bags of dried maize grains, rice, vegetables, assorted meat, etc.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
At the age of 45, Mrs. N. is widowed and working as a rice farmer in Saphjea Village in Siem Reap Province. She has five children, one of whom is married and lives away from the family home. To help support the family, three of her children (two daughters and one son) are employed as construction workers earning $150 per month. These days, Mrs. N.'s family faces difficulty because her house is old with maN. things needing repair. She is asking for a loan to purchase wood for reparations in order to improve her family's living conditions. 

Her daughter is shown in the photo because she was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase wood for housing repairs

loans.name: Iad

texts.en:
Iad is a 33 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their three children. He has been working as a taxi van driver for ten years. Iad has requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his van and pay the school tuition fees for his children. He has had loans with Al Majmoua previously and he has always paid on time.
His previous loans helped him improve his financial situation.

loans.use: Iad will use the loan to do some maintenance work on his van and pay the school tuition to his children.

loans.name: Mujeres Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.en:
Mujeres Hacia el Futuro is a large group of 20 women hoping to receive loans. This group is very mixed in that some members will be receiving their third loan, while other are on their seventh loan. The one thing they all have in common is that they are in the process of improving their lives. Many of the group members have already doubled or tripled their income, and they hope to continue raising their standard of living. 

Ynes M. is the representative of this group, and she is a perfect example of what micro-credit can do in a person's life. Ynes is the mother of one young child and before receiving her first loan, she was having a hard time feeding her child each day. Ynes had no real source of income and was just scrapping by each day. Ynes came to Esperanza International and took out her first loan a few years ago and started a small salon, selling beauty products. Through her hard work and diligence she is now taking out her seventh loan from Esperanza, and she can finally provide for her child. Her child is the love of her life, and she is so happy that she can put him through school! All she wants is a great life for her child, and she is on the right path! Ynes is so happy for the opportunity she received a couple years back, and is excited for her future! 

Thank you for all your support!!

loans.use: Buy products for her salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more pumpkin seeds to plant

loans.name: Sayadjan Aqa Group

texts.en:
This is the Sayadjan Aqa group. There are two members in this group. They live in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. And each of them would like to take out a loan for their own business.

Marwa wants to take out a loan for carpet weaving; she wants to buy necessary materials for her business. Also Fowzya wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of selling fuel and wants to buy necessary materials for his business.

They are very happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan and they want to thank Kiva and AFSG in Afghanistan.

loans.use: to expand and enlarge their businesses

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa M. is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are girls. She says one of her daughters is currently married while the rest are in primary school. Yaa lives with her husband and two other children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She is a petty trader. She sells second-hand textiles – clothes for both sexes and also bed sheets.

Yaa procures bales of textiles from Accra and sells in her community by hawking. She says she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for five years and desires to expand her business. Yaa is hopeful to improve upon her standard of living and pay for her children to attain the higher levels of academia.

loans.use: To procure second-hand textiles for re-sale

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El Señor Mario T. de 28 años de edad,  casado de oficios Tejedor, “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 1 Telar,  habita conjuntamente con su esposa y 2 hijos,  desde su niñez se dedicaba en la Artesanía gracias a los préstamos  a podido llevar a su familia adelante donde es persona muy conocida, y su residencia en el Barrio Chuicho, Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan Sololá, Guatemala. Donde ha llegado a Solicitar a la Asociación Asdir un financiamiento para la compra de materia prima para dicha artesanía para facilitar y poder cubrir la demanda a su clientela y así poder darles mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mario T., 28, is married. He is a weaver, and he makes traditional clothing for women. He has a shop with one loom. He lives with his wife and two children. He has worked in handicrafts since his childhood. Thanks to loans he has been able to help his family succeed. He is well known in his Chuicho neighborhood, Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan Sololá, Guatemala. He is asking the Asdir Association for a loan to buy raw materials for his handicrafts. This will help him be able to cover his customers’ demands. He will then be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicrafts (Buy raw material)

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en: Kemi O. is 50 years old and married with 3 children. Kemi sells foodstuffs. She is requesting the loan amount of 60,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mark

texts.en: Mark O. is twenty-nine years old. He is married and has one son who is currently in the primary school. He lives with his wife and son in a rented apartment in a town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Dwenase is a commercial and farming town. His wife trades. Mark is a cobbler by profession. He makes all kinds of footwear, such as shoes, slippers, and sandals, for both men and women. His workshop is located at the road side. Mark procures his working materials from Kumasi. He has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy more materials.

loans.use: To buy leather and shoe soles

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Замира Садирова  вот уже около 2 лет торгует на вещевом рынке Зафарабадского района. У Замиры 4 детей, в бизнесе ей помогает муж Алиер. Он ездит за товаром в город Бишкек,  а Замира продает его. Ассортимент товара Замиры состоит из женской одежды (ночные рубашки, пижамы, пеньюары), а так же детская одежда.
   Замира хочет увеличить свой товарооборот, поэтому подала заявку на получение кредита в размере 3000 сомони.
texts.en:
Zamira S. has been selling at the clothing market in the Zafarabad district for almost 2 years. Zamira has 4 children, and her husband, Alier, helps her with the business. He travels for the merchandise to the city of Bishkek, and Zamira sells the goods. Zamira’s goods assortment consists out of women’s clothing (night gowns, pajamas, peignoirs) and also children’s clothing. Zamira wants to increase her goods turnover; this is why she put in a request for a loan in the sum of 3000 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 35 years old. She is married and mother of three children. Two are schooling whilst her first is working as a trader. She is a petty trader and sells pork in the community market where she lives. She takes delivery of goods from Kumasi central market in bulk and supplies them to her loyal customers. She is constrained by funds and finds it difficult to make enough profit, making it hard to take care of her household. She requests the loan to buy a bulk supply of pork to increase her stock. She works hard to help her husband in taking care of the home.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of pork

loans.name: Charles Kihiu

texts.en: Charles M. is 39 years old and married with two children. He lives in Muguga, Kikuyu, and he has been selling animal feed for the last five years. His business is in a center called Thamanda which is near where he stays. Charles was introduced to KADET by a friend who was already a member of one of the groups. Apart from KADET, where he has borrowed two loans, he has never borrowed money from another institution before. This will be his third loan and, so far, he has a good repayment history. Charles hopes to grow his business to a wholesale shop so that he can be distributing to small traders. He also wants to diversify his trade and start selling hay, since this is a farming region and he knows that he can get high returns and maximize on his profits by tapping into this new venture. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy more animal feed to restock his business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine O. is from the village of Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 29 years old. Josephine is married and has one school-aged child. Josephine owns and operates a specialized retail store which primarily sells vegetables in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over two years.

In 2009, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid her previous loan and is requesting a new loan of $125 which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items and expand product offering

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 37 years old and single without children. She sells clothes of various sorts and sizes. She hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:
Mrs. Flaviana P. is from the village of Guinabot, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is married and blessed with four children.

She joined PMPC on April 14, 2009 in order to access their programs and services. Recently, she's obtaining her 2nd loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 as additional capital for her business and in order for her to buy new cow as additional livestock for one of her other businesses.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Sagitario Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL SAGITARIO

La Alcancía Comunal Sagitario está conformada por 10 socias responsables que viven en la comunidad de Huachipa en Ate Vitarte. La presidenta Teresa H. se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos. Su suegro le regalo a  su hija dos lechoncitos, que luego dio crías y tuvo la idea de  venderlos  así poco a poco comenzó a investigar acerca de la crianza de los cerdos, y le dio mucho resultado, ahora ella puede aportar para los gastos necesarios de su familia  ya que el trabajo es compartido.
La mayoría de las socias se dedican a ese negocio, pero como todo giro tienen desventajas, ellas nos comentan que cuando comenzó la enfermedad de la gripe AH1N1 perdieron mucho, bajo el precio y no pagaban lo que costaba, así que para poder mantenerse tuvieron que venderlos a precios muy bajos que no les cubría ningún costo por el contrario grandes pérdidas, durante ese tiempo buscaron trabajos anexos que le permitían cubrir sus gastos; ahora que se está regularizando la situación pueden continuar con su negocio, ellas saben que con una buena alimentación y manteniendo la higiene constantemente pueden vender  productos de calidad  a sus consumidores.
Las socias solicitan créditos que será destinado a la compra de alimentos balanceados para cerdos ya que en diciembre tienen mucha demanda.
texts.en:
Alcancía Communal Bank The Alcancía Communal Bank is comprised of ten responsable members who live in the Huachipa community in Ate Vitarte. The president, Teresa H., raises and sells pigs. Her father-in-law gave her daughter two piglets, and they later had babies. She had the idea to sell them. Little by little she started to investigate raising pigs. That gave her very good results. Now she can contribute to the necessary family expenses because the work is shared. The majority of the members work in this business. Like all fields, it has its disadvantages. The members tell us that when the AH1N1 flu started, they lost a lot, prices dropped, and they were not paid what the pigs cost them. In order to be able to get by they had to sell them a very low prices that did not cover any of their costs. To the contrary, they had big losses. During this time they looked for other work that would allow them to cover their expenses. Now that the situation is normalizing they can continue with their business. They know that with good feeding and by always maintaining hygiene they are able to sell their quality products to consumers. The members are asking for loans to buy balanced food for the pigs because there is much demand in December.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Choeurn

texts.en:
Mr. B., 31, is a local teacher from Battambang Province. In addition to teaching, Mr. B. also assists his wife with selling groceries when he has free time. Mr. B. has been married a number of years, but doesn't have any children.  

Since selling groceries is the main source of the family's income, Mr. B. is applying for a loan to expand the quantity of inventory items.

Note: Mr. B.'s wife appears in the picture above.

loans.use: expand their inventory

loans.name: Ren

texts.en:
Mrs. Ren M. lives in Si Sla village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Leng Ly, is a motorbike taxi driver. He is also a farmer who owns 1.5-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. On this plantation, he faces some problems, because his field is far from the irrigation system and the soil needs fertilizer.

Thus, Mrs. Ren M. is requesting a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizers, pesticides, and a water pump. She plans to use the rest of money to buy two more piglets for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions. She is 48 years old and the mother of four children; one is a laborer, and the others attend the local school.

loans.use: Buy rice seed, fertilizers, pesticides, a water pump for the farm, and two more piglets for breeding

loans.name: José Enrique

texts.es:
José tiene 44 años de edad, es separado,  tiene una hija de nueve años de edad y vive junto a su madre en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, tiene un auto que cubre la ruta Paiján - Puerto Malabrigo y viceversa. Este negocio ha sido la fuente de ingreso que le ha permitido sustentar sus gastos familiares y sacar adelante a los que más quiere. Por lo que día a día se esfuerza al máximo en su trabajo.

Debido al constante uso su auto sufrió algunas fallas que lo dejaron inoperativo y que requieren de reparación urgente. José se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para reparar y mantener su vehículo ya que no cuenta con los recursos economicos para realizar esta acción. 

El es un hombre bastante trabajador y empeñoso. Su más grande anhelo es poder asociarse a una empresa formal de transporte con la cual pueda trabajar de manera más estable.
texts.en:
Jose is 44 years old, separated, and has a nine-year-old daughter. He lives together with his mother in the district of Paijan, province of Ascope, in the region La Libertad, located three hours away from the city of Chiclayo. He makes a living by transporting passengers in his car, covering the route from Paijan to Puerto Malabrigo and viceversa. This business has been the source of income that has allowed him to cover his family expenses and help the ones he loves the most get ahead. Therefore, each day he puts forth maximum effort in his job. Due to constant use, his car suffered a few defects that left it inoperable and in need of urgent repair. Jose sees it necessary to request for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to repair and maintain his vehicle, since he does not have the economic resources to carry out these actions. He is a very industrious and hard-working man. His greatest wish is to become associated with a formal transporation company, with which he can work in a more stable manner.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expenses for repairing and maintaining his car

loans.name: Bridaine

texts.es:
Nuestra socia BRIDAINE tiene 35 años es casada y tiene dos hijos. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención de su pequeño negocio de venta de repuestos de carros. Ya son varios años que tiene el negocio y le ha ido muy bien, gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia a pesar de las dificultades de la vida. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar un motor que cuesta $2800 dólares. Con el dinero del préstamo de los $ 1000 dólares va a cubrir una parte de la compra y la otra parte del dinero el cliente le dará a las socia como adelanto de la compra y así de esta manera la socia adquirirá el motor. 
 
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “HUAYNA CCAPAC” de la Asociación Arariwa de la Provincia del Cusco del Departamento del Cusco.   

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Bridaine is 35, married, and has two children. She alternates her activities between the home and her small business selling replacement parts for cars. She has had the business for several years, and it has gone very well for her thanks to all of the effort she puts into her work. She is an enterprising and hard-working mother who gets her family ahead in spite of life’s difficulties. She needs a loan to buy a motor that costs $2,800. The money from the loan for $1,000 will cover part of the purchase. The other part of the money will be advanced. That way she will get the motor. She belongs to the Huayna Ccapac Communal Bank of the Arariwa Association in the Cusco province, Cusco department. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a motor

loans.name: Osayuki

texts.en:
Osayuki is 34 years old and married with four children, the youngest of whom is one year old. She is a client of Kiva partner, Lift Above Poverty Organization. Osayuki sells groceries and foodstuffs to earn a living. She has been in this business for a long time. In the future, Osayuki hopes to own a supermarket. She is requesting a loan of 70,000 NGN to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

About Lift Above Poverty Organization
Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Belsabe

texts.es:
Belsabé es una comerciante de 33 años, trabaja en coordinación con su esposo para cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Ellos tienen dos hijos; Brenda de 14 y Alejandra de 5 años, quienes son la alegría de su casa.
Durante el invierno se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, esta actividad la inicia a partir de las 11 de la mañana, horario cuando encuentra a sus clientes en sus casas; y por las tardes visita a las clientes en sus trabajos. En este éste negocio lleva 6 años y recién siente que está cosechando el fruto de su esfuerzo.  
Para esta estación de verano está vendiendo accesorios de aseo personal en la playa, y teniendo 14 años de comerciante, ya es reconocida en la zona.
Belsabé es una mujer muy amigable y conversadora, y vender es lo que mejor sabe hacer, por ello aprovecha todas las oportunidades que se le presenten.
Para el futuro, anhela tener una tienda de adornos y joyas en su casa, para eso está segura que debe trabajar muchísimo más.

Aunque este sea el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP, ratifica su compromiso de pagar sus cuotas con puntualidad, ya que su anhelo es seguir trabajando responsablemente para surgir en la vida. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en el incrementó de productos de belleza y accesorios de higiene, para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Belsabé is a trader who is 33 years old. She works in coordination with her husband to cover the bills. They have two children: Brenda who is 14 and Alejandra who is 5, who are the happiness of the home. During the winter, she is dedicated to selling beauty products. She begins this activity at 11 in the morning, a time when she finds her customers in their homes. And in the afternoons, she visits her customers at their jobs. She has been running this business for six years and recently she feels she is benefiting from the fruit of her labors. For the summer season, she is selling personal grooming products at the beach and through having 14 years experience as a trader, she is well known in the area. Belsabé is a very friendly woman and a conversationalist and selling is what she knows how to do best. For this, she takes advantage of all the opportunities that crop up. For the future, she longs to have an accessories and jewelry store in her home. For this, she is sure that she needs to work a lot more. Although this is the fourth loan that she's had with MFP, she affirms her promise to make her payments punctually since her dream is to continue working responsibly to get ahead in life. The money that she is requesting now will be used to increase her stock of beauty products and hygiene accessories to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of merchandise.

loans.name: Limota

texts.en: To earn a living in her town in Nigeria, Limota sells planks at retail prices to her customers, who are usually friends and neighbors. In the future, she hopes to expand her business to cover a wider territory. For now, she has applied for a loan for NGN 140,000 to buy more planks to sell. She loves her business because it is highly profitable. Limoita is 45 years old, married and has five children. She extends her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders for making this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more wood planks to sell to her customers

loans.name: Khsang

texts.en:
Mrs. Khsang H., 54, is a widowed mother caring for four children who are students in the local public school. She currently earns a living planting vegetable crops. All of her children also work by growing crops when they are not studying. One of her daughters is working in a restaurant. 

Khsang H. planted her crop a month ago, but her crop is not growing well. Because of this problem, she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer that she will use to increase her crop yield. The rest of the loan she will use to repair her old house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Ko'e Pyahu Kuñakuerape Group

texts.es:
Las mencionadas mujeres son del Barrio San Blas de la Ciudad de Caacupe. 

Son señoras que en su mayoría trabajan como comerciantes en venta de todo tipo de productos como ser ropas, artículos de mercería, joyas, comestibles y pequeñas despensa. Todas trabajan con mucho esfuerzo y salir adelante de manera digno con toda la familia.

Las mismas están agradecidas por tan valiosa oportunidad que les brinda la Fundación, y esperan cada día capacitarse adquirir experiencias dentro del programa y cumplir sus obligaciones como socias.
Entre las integrantes encuentra la señora Maria A. quien se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, ella ofrece sus productos de forma ambulante recorriendo las casa  y negocios de sus cliente, el trabajo de la señora es muy sacrificado.
Ella se muy temprano a la mañana para ir al mercado y abastecerse de sus productos, actualmente quiere abrir un puesto de venta  frente a casa   , el crédito fue utilizado para la compra de frutas y verduras para vender.
texts.en:
The women listed are from the San Blas neighborhood of the city of Caacupe. Most of the women work as merchants selling all types of products such as clothing, dry goods, jewelry, or food. Some operate small convenience stores. They all put a lot of effort into their work so that they and their families can get ahead in a dignified fashion.

They are all thankful for the valuable opportunity offered to them by la Fundación Paraguaya and hope that each day they are able to acquire experience in the program and fulfill their obligations as members.

Among the members is Señora Maria A. who is engaged in the sale of fruits and vegetables. She offers her products on an itinerant basis going to the houses and businesses of her customers. Her work is very difficult.

She gets up very early in the morning in order to go to the market and supply herself with her products. Currently she wants to open a sales stand in front of her house. The loan is for the purchase of fruits and vegetables to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer
