loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables such as apples, pears, oranges, tomatoes, carrots, onions, and peppers.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet B. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 27 years-old and married with three school-aged children. Janet owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Janet has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Janet joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janet is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Ramona Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Ramona del Rosario M. es soltera de profesión, profesora de primaria desde hace quince años en la escuela Efraín Tijerino Mazariego, vive en reparto José Benito Centeno tiene dos hijos pero solo uno depende de ella.

La señora Ramona del Rosario M. es primer vez que trabaja con crédito en esta institución con el fin de realizar la construcción de un  cuarto en su casa de habitación
texts.en:
Ramona del Rosario M. is single; she has been an elementary school teacher at Efraín Tijerino Mazariego school for 15 years. She lives in José Benito Centeno neighborhood and has two children but only one still depends on her. This is her first loan with this institution and she will use the funds to add a room to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Rumba

texts.en: Rumba is a married man with five boys, four of whom attend school. He is a tailor and wants to purchase materials and a sewing machine with the KES 40,000 loan. He has been in the business for eight years and was previously a preacher. He has a shop, and his customers are mainly women. The greatest challenge to his business is getting pictures of dress designs from the internet and the cost of expansion. He aspires to work together with other tailors. Rumba rents his home and has electricity but no piped water.

loans.use: To purchase materials and a sewing machine

loans.name: Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario Guadalupe esta ubicado en la colonia Morazan de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, esta integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan.

la señora Francisca Sugey G. tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera y dependen de ella 4 hijos, recibe  apoyo economico del padre de sus hijos.
Francisca se dedica a la venta de abarroteria, tiene 5 años de tener su pulperia la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulperia SUGEY.
el credito lo utilzara para comprar mas abarroteria como ser jabones, papel higienico, sopas, refrescos, chiles, churros, manteca, aceite, frijoles tortillas, harina de maiz y trigo, pan, galletas, arroz, azucar etc.

la sra. Waleska Yamileth G. V. tiene 33 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Elvis Alexander Romero quien es albañil, ambos se ayudan mutuamente en los gastos mensuales del hogar.
Waleska se dedica a la venta de lacteos, charamuscas y ropa.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar lacteos.

la señora  Berta Marina V. M. tiene 52 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Oscar Armando G. quien se dedica a la albañileria, tienen un hijo.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar telas.
tambien vende golosinas los fines de semana.

Todos ellos juntos trabajando duro lograran salir adelante con sus familias y sus negocios.
texts.en:
The cohesive group called Guadalupe is located in the Morazan colony in the city of San Lorenzo. There are three hardworking women that comprise the group. Below are the details of the different activities that they do Mrs. Francisca is 31 years old, is a single mother and has four children that are dependent upon her. She receives economic support from the father of the children. Francisca sells groceries. She has had a grocery store for five years. It is called SUGEY grocery store. With this loan she will buy more groceries such as soaps, toilet paper, soups, soda, chiles, churros, margarine, oil, beans, tortillas, corn and wheat flour, bread, cookies, rice, sugar, etc. Mrs. Waleska is 33 years old. She lives with Mr. Elvis who is a mason. They both help with household expenses. Waleska sells milk products, popsicles and clothes. She will use this loan to buy milk products. Mrs. Berta is 52 years old and is married to Mr. Oscar. Mr. Oscar is a mason. They have one child. She will use the loan to buy fabric. She also sells candy on the weekends. All of these people are working together to help their families and businesses progress.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood, corn, fabric, milk products, groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing mobile phones [for resale]

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: La señora Gloria Maria A. tiene 48 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, dos mayores de edad y dos menores. La señora tiene en su casa un negocio de venta de mercadería en general, ella vende leña, frijoles cocidos, frutas, golosinas, etc. Ella ya tiene 2 años de tener este negocio, el cual empezó debido al bajo salario que ganaba su esposo el cual trabaja como guarda de seguridad, esto con el objetivo de brindar manutención a sus hijos. Ella desea este crédito con el objetivo de realizar compras variadas de sus productos, ya que quiere empezar a vender más para ganarles más. Además, aduce la señora, cada día los precios de los productos están cada día más caros. Este se ha convertido en un desafió para ella, debido a que la situación económica del país cada día está más difícil. Ella sueña con seguir adelante en su negocio, tratando siempre de que sus hijos estudien y se preparen.
texts.en:
Gloria María A., 48, is married and has 4 children, two adults and two minors. She has a general store in her home where she sells firewood, cooked beans, fruit, snacks, etc. She has been in this line of work for 2 years. She began it because her husband’s salary as a security guard was too low and she needed more income to support her children. She wants this loan in order to buy assorted products to stock in order to increase sales and profits. She also cites the fact that product prices are rising daily; this has become quite a challenge for her because the country’s economic situation is more difficult each day. She dreams with being able to continue with her store always trying to insure that her children study and prepare themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: United Women Group

texts.en:
Korto K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called United Women. She is 40 years old, is married, and has five children who range from 1 to 24 years old. She was not able to attend school due to poverty.

For 20 years, Korto has been selling frozen fish and chicken in FDA Market, Paynesville, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

Korto plans to use her 12,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 48,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more frozen fish and chicken. She describes herself as very hardworking.

Korto’s goal is to improve her business, build a shop, and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more frozen fish and chicken to sell

loans.name: Kipngetich

texts.en:
Kipngetich owns and operates a mixed farm in Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He produces milk, which he sells to the tea estate and tea which he sells to Kenya Tea Development Authority and to Finlays company. He has been farming for the past 7 years and has employed one farm hand. He is also a driver.

Kipngetich is 30 years old, married and blessed with 3 children. The children are between the ages of 3 and 7. All of the children attend school. Kipngetich would like to improve his dairy farming by purchasing four more dairy cows, which will produce at least 20 litres of milk each, on a daily basis. He has requested this loan of KES 50,000 to purchase and insure these dairy cows. He says these dairy cows will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and will also increase his income through the sale of milk. He will, therefore, reduce the cost of buying milk for his family and he will also have increased income that will enable him pay school fees for his children.

Kipngetich says that he would like to stay with Juhudi in the future so that he can be able to purchase another piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase and insure more dairy cows.

loans.name: Pat

texts.en: Mrs. Pat H. is a 43-year-old farmer and mother. She was blessed with six children, two of whom are married and the other four are single. To help with the responsibility for family expenses, three of her daughters are employed in the garment factory. Pat H. has another financial earner in her husband who is a skilled producer of handmade wooden beds, from which he earns a living. Recently, Pat H.’s husband got many orders for beds from his customers but he lacks items to meet this orders. Therefore, Pat H. decided to ask for a Kiva loan for her husband to use to buy raw materials to make additional beds for his customers.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make additional beds for his customers.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng S., 42, is married and lives with her three children in Kampong Chnang province. She works in a grocery store, making approximately US$ 3.50 each day, and her husband is a construction worker building houses. Her family is also supported by her husband’s US$ 3 income each day, along with the income of two children who are employed. 

Leng S. is asking for a loan of US$ 1200 to expand her grocery inventory and purchase a plot of farmland to grow rice. She believes that these purchases will allow her to increase her income and be able to better support her large family.

loans.use: To expand her grocery inventory and buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto C. is from the village of Lurugan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. He is 45 years old. Roberto is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Roberto owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Roberto has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Roberto joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Roberto is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Roberto from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Posiano

texts.en:
This story is connected to one T. Posiano from Kagugu, Rukungiri who has been in the agricultural sector for more than 20 years.  We can say that different genres of agro activities have made many Ugandan families have an improved lease on life.   
                                    
This married man has subsisted on a variety of agricultural products, specializing in growing bananas and looking after cows. Though adverse weather conditions have constantly affected his plantations, he has managed to consolidate the gains he has made. As a result his family of six children has enjoyed the benefits principally; his children have all gone to good institutions of learning. 

In a month, Posiano reveals that he makes good profit from sales of his agricultural products. He is very upbeat that with this loan he will be in a position to improve the mulching and gardening aspects of his farm and also increase the stock of animals on the farm which will help him increase the produce and sales revenue. This will provide a base for him to meet his goal of educating all his children.

loans.use: buying mulches and fertilizers

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, de 31 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Yony de 36 años y su hijo Edison de 11 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los arduos días de trabajo que Gladys tiene en su chacra, le han servido para mejorar sus cultivos y hacer más productivas sus tierras, trabaja desde muy temprano por la mañana, cultivando papas y habas, productos que posteriormente llevará a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Paralelamente a esta actividad, ella también tiene una tienda de abarrotes, con la cual surte de víveres a todo su poblado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y ver como sus cultivos van creciendo, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus tierras de la plaga de insectos. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras y así ampliar la cantidad de su producción. Este el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para sus chacras, también comprará más productos, para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Gladys, 31, is a very loving, cheerful mother.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Yony, 36, and her son Edison, 11, who are the reasons behind all her efforts.

The hard days of labor Gladys puts into her fields have led to improved crops and more productive fields.  She works from very early in the morning cultivating potatoes and lima beans, products she subsequently takes to Tarma’s wholesale market to sell.  She also has a grocery store that supplies the entire settlement with foodstuffs.

What she enjoys most about her work is planting her fields and seeing how the plants develop.  She has been in this activity for 10 years and considers the most difficult part seeing that her plants are safe from insect infestations.  In time she’d like to buy more land to expand production.

This is her 4th loan with MFP.  She knows that if she pays on time she will be able to request another more easily and without causing complications for her communal bank where she is very well liked by all the members.

She will use the requested 3000 new soles to buy manure for the fields as well as for more stock items for her store.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Cymberly

texts.en:
Cymberly D. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 26 years old. Cymberly is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling household products like coffee, vinegar, soy sauce and canned goods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cymberly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and as working capital. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell and as working capital

loans.name: Shadiya

texts.en:
Shadiya M. is 48 years old, married and has three children. From her childhood, Shadiya was eager to study and after finishing school, she continued her studies in Medical University. After graduating, she got a job as a pharmacist. When Shadiya was 22, she got married and soon gave a birth to her son and daughter. 

In order to find a means of subsistence for their children, Shadiya and her husband went to Russia in search of a livelihood. After coming back, they were able to buy a house in Ak-Suu village. There, in 1995, Shadiya gave birth to her youngest son who is the main helper in all her activities. In order to find a means of subsistence for her family, in 2000, Shadiya decided to start her business with the initial capital of 15,000 Kyrgyz Soms.  She opened a pharmacy in her village and became a person who is held in high respect by her fellow villagers. Also, in order to find additional earnings, Shadiya started to breed cattle, and with the revenues she was able to give a good dowry to her daughter. 

Now Shadiya is applying for loan of 100,000 Kyrgyz Soms to raise her turnover, which will allow her to broaden her business. In future, she dreams of enlarging the numbers of pharmacies in order to help her customers to overcome their medical problems. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to broaden her business

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a married man with two children who attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

He operates a retail shop, selling sugar, wheat flour, maize flour and tea leaves for over three years. His potential customers are neighbors and food vendors. Julius faces a major challenge of high cost of transporting goods from the market place where he purchases them, to his shop for resale. He hopes to open a wholesale shop someday. 

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase stock of wheat flour and maize flour for sale at his retail shop. He decided to join Yehu to get loans and improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase stock of wheat flour and maize flour for sale at his retail shop.

loans.name: Rosario Verónica

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Monserrate  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Rosario, ella tiene 35 años de edad, esta casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 11 y 6 años, y  están estudiando  el mayor en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es chofer.
 
Es una muy buena ama de casa que además de estar atenta en el cuidado de su hogar también se dedica al comercio, tiene un pequeño bazar en el cual además de ropa, zapatos y bisutería, también vende productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 18h00. Sus mercadería se la envían desde Guayaquil y Quito dos veces por mes. 

Este crédito es para comprar más productos como ropa,  bisutería, zapatos y  productos Yanbal. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 12 años y le gusta por las charlas educativas. Su sueño es tener un gran bazar.
texts.en:
The María Monserrate community bank meets every fortnight in Montecristi canton which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts which are well known both nationally and internationally.  It is the home of the famous Panama hat.

Here we meet 35 year-old Rosario.  She is married and has two children aged 11 and 6 who are both in school.  Her husband is a driver.

María is a very good housewife who, in addition to looking after her home, is also a saleswoman.  She has a small store where she sells clothes, shoes, jewelry and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She works every day from 8.30am to 6.00pm.  Her merchandise is sent from Guayaquil and Quito twice a month.

This loan will be used to buy more products such as clothes, jewelry, shoes and Yanbal products.   María has been a member of her community bank for 12 years and she likes the educational talks which they provide.  Her dream is to have a bigger store.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes and Yanbal products

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en:
Ararat is married with three sons. He and his wife have a family business - growing early spring vegetables (tomatoes, cucumbers, etc) in greenhouses. They have been in this business for eight years. Hard work and persistence have helped them to develop this business well. Today, Ararat has got three large greenhouses to grow the vegetables.

Last year, Ararat got his first micro loan and found it very helpful for his business. This year, he would like to borrow 15,000 hryvnias to build one more greenhouse that would allow him to increase the sales in spring.

loans.use: To build one more greenhouse

loans.name: Hor

texts.en:
Hor Y. is a 43-year-old woman who currently lives in the province of Kompong Tom. She is a local chef. She is frequently hired by neighbors to cook meals for their wedding parties and other ceremonies.

Hor Y. lives with her parents and other relatives under one roof. Her parents could earn their own living by planting a rice crop.

On average, Hor Y. can make an income of approximately $4.80 per day. She shares her income with her parents and relatives so they can meet the family's expenses.

Presently, Hor Y. is not comfortable, because her kitchen often needs to be repaired. She would like a loan to buy wood to repair her broken kitchen.

loans.use: To buy wood to repair her broken kitchen.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan M., 44, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known for being the most populated city in the country. She sells porridge, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is employed as a civil servant, earning an income of USD 2 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 105 on food, USD 15 on the children’s education, and USD 5 on other necessary expenses. M. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase more supplies to improve her current business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more supplies to improve the current business.

loans.name: Moureen

texts.en: Moureen is a 26-year-old married woman with three children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling palm oil and cotton for the last seven years. She started out with capital of 50,000 UGX and now has capital of 500,000 UGX. Her hardship is the difficulty in transporting the palm oil as it sometimes pours downwards. Moureen envisions educating her children and expanding her business. Moureen intends to use the loan to buy cotton.

loans.use: buying cotton for planting

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa is a 55-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three businesses: Ready to Wear clothing, Rice Vending and Snack Vending. She lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her Ready to Wear, Rice Vending and Snack businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 18,400. Gaudiosa is borrowing PHP 16,000 to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Gaudiosa aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en:
Kumba O. K. is 39 years old, married to Naisoi K., and blessed with five children; all are schooling. He is a farmer and he does the farming activity on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last seven years.

He learned about KADET LTD from other men in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his third loan with which he is planning to spend to buy eight bags of Kenya seed certified wheat and eight bags of fertilizer. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to build a permanent home and expand his farming activity.

Kumba's dream is construct rental houses and educate his children in order for them to have a better future. He is an industrious man who is determined to achieve his objectives.

loans.use: to buy eight bags of Kenya seed certified wheat and eight bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Ednah

texts.en:
Ednah C., a 30-year-old married mother of three children who are all in primary school, has operated a beauty salon in the town of Eldoret for the past six years; she earns a monthly income of 7,000 shillings.

This will be Ednah's second loan with KADET LTD after having repaid her first one. She plans to use it to boost her business by buying new hair products, hair shampoo, a hair dryer, etc. In the future, Ednah would like to build a house with her husband and educate her children to the highest level.

loans.use: to buy hair relaxer, shampoo and a hair dryer for her business

loans.name: Jeneian

texts.en:
Jeneian is married with two children who are both in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jeneian is 34 years old. 

Jeneian has a machine shop business in the Philippines. Jeneian requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional equipment for her machine shop.

Jeneian has been in this business for five years. In the future, Jeneian would like to improve her business and for her children to finish with a college education.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for her machine shop

loans.name: Triumphant Friends Group

texts.es: La alcancía Comunal “Amigos triunfadores” está conformada por nueve personas emprendedoras, se dedican al comercio y servicio en su comunidad. Kandy es la presidenta electa y a sus 37 años y con una pequeña niña a su cargo se desenvuelve  como asistenta D. salud,  trabaja para un área D. salud realizando visitas a pacientes con TBC y VIH, a la vez se dedica a vender productos cosméticos D. diversas compañías hace 20 años. Con su esfuerzo D. cada día ha logrado mantener estable a su niña D. 09 años D. edad pues padece D. una enfermedad y ha mejorado su calidad D. vida. El dinero D. préstamo será invertido en comprar cremas, perfumes para ampliar su stock. Su sueño es ver crecer a su hija y poder abrir una perfumería en casa D. sus padres ya que cuenta aun con el apoyo D. ellos. Kandy y sus socios D. la Alcom “Amigos Triunfadores” empiezan  en el programa incentivados por el afán D. ahorro. El nombre D. sus grupo lo dice todo se han reunido para triunfar. Podemos verles en la foto luego D. acto D. desembolso, la Sra. Esther no está por motivo D. una emergencia en su casa. Pero juramento como vocal. Los socios están optimistas y agradecidos por el préstamo recibido.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "Triumphant Friends" is maD. up of nine enterprising individuals. They  are dedicated to commerce and to providing services in their community. Kandy is the elected leader of the group. She is 37 years of age and she has little girl in her care. She is a health  
care assistant. She works in a field of health care where she pays visits to patients with tuberculosis and HIV. She has also sold cosmetics of various brand names for the past 20 years. With her daily work she has been able to support her 9-year old daughter who suffers from an illness, and she has improved the quality of their life. The funds from this loan will be invested in the purchase of skin lotions and perfumes to supplement her stock. Her dream is to see her daughter grow up and to be able to open a perfume store in her parents' house, seeing as she has their support. Kandy and her colleagues of the communal bank "Triumphant Friends" have started an incentive program with the goal of saving money. The name of their group says it all. They have come together to be triumphant. The photo shows them when they are receiving their loans. Esther is not in the photo because she has a personal emergency but she has maD. a verbal promise. The members are optimists and they are thankful for the loan they have received.

loans.use: to purchase skin lotions and perfumes

loans.name: Las Violetas Group

texts.es: La Sra. Edita  es casada, tiene 7 hijos, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Las Violetas” grupo  conformado por 8  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Edita   trabaja desde hace  15 años en la venta de golosinas en frente de un  colegio este trabajo surge porque ella quería ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y la manutención de sus hijos ya que lo que su esposo ganaba no era suficiente para mantener a sus 7 hijos  y a su vez trabaja en un comedor popular de cocinera , pero gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mejores ingresos económicos , sus hijos pueden ir al colegio ,  se ha comprado algunos artefactos eléctricos y sobre todo su familia tiene una mejor calidad de vida. El préstamo que se le otorgo fue para comprar mercadería.  Sabemos que Edita  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Edita is married and has seven children.  She is currently a member of 'Las Violetas' community bank.  This bank has eight members who all work in different business activities.  Edita has been selling candies opposite a high school for 15 years.  This work came about because she wanted to help her husband with their household expenses and in supporting their children since her husband's earnings weren't enough to support their seven children.  Edita also works as a cook in a popular eatery.  Thanks to her effort and commitment, she has managed to make more income, her children are able to go to school, she has bought some electrical appliances and, above all, her family now enjoys a better quality of life.

The loan that Edita was given was to be used for buying merchandise.  We know that Edita will fulfil her goals with a lot of work and effort, and that Edaprospo's loans will help her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth K. is 41 years old and from Galenga villege in Vihiga. She is a widow and a mother of three children.

Ruth has a business of selling rope and has been in it for the past 13 years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd. after being introduced by a friend. Ruth wants to use the money to buy more rope to add to her stock. 

She hopes to establish her business which will, in turn, improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more rope to add to her stock.

loans.name: Go Try Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Go Try” group, small scale businesspeople based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Abu Bakar, a native of Magburaka. He is 40 years old and married to a merchant. The couple has 5 children – 3 in primary school and 2 in secondary school. Abu Bakar has been a businessman for 10 years, selling biscuits, toothpaste, toothbrushes, cigarettes, etc. With this loan, Abu Bakar will buy these items wholesale to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, toothpaste, toothbrushes, cigarettes, etc. wholesale to add to his business

loans.name: Ruth Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora. Ruth vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad es muy visitada por su belleza natural y arquitectónica, es la tercera ciudad de más importante  del país, cuenta con una variada gastronomía la misma que cautiva a propios y extraños, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.
 
Doña Ruth tiene 32 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 16, 15, 13, 10 y 8 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión gasfitero (reparación  de tuberías), no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora Ruth se dedica al comercio de juguetes, labora en esta actividad de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, se encuentra en este negocio hace 2 años.
 
Este  el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  más juguetes para continuar en el negocio.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ruth lives in the outskirts of Cuenca. This city is known for its natural beauty and its architecture. It is the third most important city in the country. Locals and foreigners are captivated by the variety of cuisine. The people who live here maintain their culture and traditions.
Mrs. Ruth is 32 years old, married, with five children ages 16,15,13.10 and 8. The three oldest children go to high school and the younger ones study at a small school in their city. Her husband is a plumber (he repairs pipes). They don’t have their own house. They are leasing a house.
Mrs. Ruth sells toys. She works from Sunday to Sunday but doesn’t have a fixed schedule. She has been doing this work for the past two years.
This is her third loan from the Community Bank. A friend invited her to join the bank. She will use the loan to buy more toys in order to continue with her business.
Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy toys.

loans.name: Oyunerdene

texts.en:
Oyunerdene is 25 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Hentii province of Mongolia. Her daughter, who is 2 years old, attends kindergarten while her husband manages a taxi service in his town.  Oyundrdene manages a clothing business at a rented stall at a trading center. She started her business in January, 2011. Now her working capital exceeds 3,000,000 MNT, with daily earnings of 50,000-60,000 MNT. She is planning to expand her business in the future. She is a hardworking lady who says, "I want to continue my business, because it is a source of income for my family. Also I would like to have a house for my family."

 She is requesting a 3,200,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Munhtsetseg

texts.en: Munhtsetseg is 37 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her older two children attend secondary school while the younger one is in kindergarten. Her husband is a driver who operates his own transportation business. She manages a tailoring business at her workshop. She started her business in 2006 with a workshop built near her home. She receives quite a lot orders from her customers and sells her products while visiting homes. She is a hardworking lady who wants to have her own shop and to employ more workers. She says, "I would like to do construction and decoration work at my work place and to have a new sewing machine for my business." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a new sewing machine and to repair her work place.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Than

texts.en: Mr. Than has been spending his life cultivating crops and some fruit on his own fertile land. He learned this skill from his parent when he was single. He is now married and has three school-aged kids. His wife works in the farm fields frequently alongside him. Growing crops is an annual action with which he has had great success. He is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall is good for his crop. However, Mr. Than doesn’t have capital yet to use on his farm. So, Mr. Than is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting. With this loan, he will increase his net incomes by selling his crops when they are mature.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds.

loans.name: Yesenia Maria

texts.es:
Yesenia María tiene 29 años de edad, es casada vive con su esposo e hijos de 11, 10 años y 4 meses, en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C ALLI KAUSAY, se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Tolapungo, sector Veintimilla, perteneciente al cantón Guaranda, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales, comercio de ganado, legumbres y otros.

Yesenia se dedica al comercio de legumbres, agricultura, crianza de animales, el esposo se dedica a la construcción, tiene una cuadra de terreno, siembra maíz, trigo, habas, papas, además tiene dos vacas lecheras. Compra sus productos en Ambato y vende en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda.
 
Solicita el crédito para, la compras de abonos, semillas comida para los animales y para pagar el transporte. El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la presencia de plagas en sus cultivos y falta de dinero. Su sueño es adquirir un vehículo para abaratar costos del producto que siembra.

Le gusta visitar a sus familiares, además las fiestas tradicionales de su comunidad compartir con los amigos.
texts.en:
Yesenia María, 29, is married and lives with her husband and children, who are 11, 10 and 4 years old, in Guaranda Canton, Bolívar Province.

The members of the Calli Kausay communal bank are located in the community of Tolapungo, Veintimilla Sector, belonging to Guaranda Canton.  They are in farming, livestock raising, livestock sales, vegetable sales and others.

Yesenia sells vegetables, farms, and raises livestock.  Her husband works in construction.  She has a cuadra (unit of land measurement) of farmland where she grows corn, wheat, Lima beans and potatoes. She also has two dairy cows.  She buys her products in Ambato and her sales take place in the Guaranda wholesale market.

She is asking for the loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds, feed for her animals, and for transportation costs.  The loan will help her meet her economic needs and improve her farming activities.  She faces challenges like crop pests.  Her dream is to acquire a vehicle to lessen costs of production.

She enjoys visiting her relatives and the community’s traditional festivals.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds, feed for her animals, and for transportation costs

loans.name: Gladys Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Gladys se  dedica a la elaboración de pan y quesadillas, con este negocio ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, se esfuerza de lunes a sábado desde muy temprano para elaborar sus panes y quesadillas, luego prepara sus productos ya que tiene que salir a la ciudad a repartirlos, sus clientes son personas que visitan el mercado nuevo de San Lorenzo y los empleados de la empacadora de camarónes de esa zona.
Gladys tiene planes de invertir su préstamo en la compra de leña y maíz que son la materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos.

Su meta a corto plazo es terminar de arreglar su casa con las ganancias de las ventas de su negocio.
texts.en:
Gladys makes bread and quesadillas. With this business, she has been able to get her family ahead. She works Monday through Sunday starting very early to make her bread and quesadillas. Later she gets her products ready, since she goes out to the city to distribute them. Her customers are people who visit the new market of San Lorenzo and the employees of a shrimp packing plant in the area.  

Gladys has plans to invest her loan in buying firewood and corn, which are the raw materials to make her products.  

Her short term goal is to fix up her house with the earnings from her sales.

loans.use: to buy firewood and corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase juice flavors, sugar and fruits, and also cloth materials.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
El Señor Isidro es de la ciudad de Carapeguá y vive en una de las compañías. Tiene 62 años de edad y está casado hace más de  40 años con la Señora María Avelina y tienen siete hijos todos  mayores de edad.
Hace más de 30 años que el Señor Isidro se dedica a la fabricación y ventas de las tradicionales frazadas y colchas que lleva a venderlo a cuotas por la  zona de Luque, transportándose en su motocicleta. Gracias a este trabajo logró brindar una modesta casa a su familia y pudo hacerse de varias comodidades en su hogar. Él se define como un hombre trabajador y luchador.
              Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hamacas, frazadas y sábanas puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos.
texts.en:
Isidro is from the city of Carapeguá and lives in one of its hamlets. He is 62 years old and has been married to María Avelina for more than 40 years. They have seven children who are all grown. 

For more than 30 years Isidro has worked making and selling traditional blankets and bedspreads that he brings to the Luque area to sell, transporting them on his motorcycle. Thanks to this work he has been able to provide his family with a modest home and to make the home comfortable in several ways. He sees himself as a hardworking and tenacious man.  

He asks for a loan to buy hammocks, blanks, and sheets since he has many requests for these items.

loans.use: to buy hammocks, blankets, sheets, and other items for his business.

loans.name: Oliva

texts.es:
Olivia, una emprendedora oriunda de la ciudad de Medellín es una mujer que con gran esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante y conseguir lo básico para sobrevivir. Con una energía inagotable pues, soltera, madre de 1 hijo y con la necesidad de generar ingresos, decidió comenzar su propio negocio, Olivia confecciona pijamas, vestidos y ropa en general, y aunque su jornada laboral es extenuante, se siente feliz de trabajar y valerse por si misma, así como prestarle un servicio a la comunidad y de generar empleos indirectos.

Olivia espera seguir confeccionando sus prendas y para ello necesita de un préstamo con el cual comprar insumos como telas hilos, y materia prima en general para la próxima colección, con el fin de ampliar su clientela, sacar más producción y proporcionalmente incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Olivia is an entrepreneur from the city of Medellín.  She is a woman who has managed to move ahead in life through great effort, and achieve the basics for 
survival.  She has an inexhaustible energy, and as she is single with a son and needed to earn money, she decided to start her own business.  Olivia sews pajamas, dresses and clothes in general, and although her daily work is strenuous, she feels happy to be working and makes the most of it, providing service to the community and generating indirect employment.

Olivia hopes to continue sewing her items, and to do this she needs a loan with which to buy supplies such as fabric, thread, and raw materials in general for her next collection.  Her end goal is to grow her customer base, grow her production, and correspondingly increase her income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her next clothing collection.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is 28 years old. He has two children between the age of 2 and 4. His wife works as a tailor and Alphonse sells fabrics. He has been working in this business for five years. 

Alphonse requested this loan to add more fabrics of different kinds and types to his inventory. The profits will be used in making savings, paying school fees and providing food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is 61 years old and lives in Tuyabang Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is married with 3 children. Anita has a hog fattening business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase more feed for her pigs. Anita has been a member of PMPC 8 years.

loans.use: to purchase more feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last five years.  She is 23 years old and single.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers during marketing and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs for use in her farm.

In the future, Hannah hopes to improve and expand her farming business as well as make more profits and improve her living standards.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Luvina Clementina

texts.es:
La Señora. Luvina es socia del banco comunal Luz y Vida, vive por la comunidad del Aguacate en la ciudad de Cuenca, en este lugar su gente es muy amable y de un corazón muy cálido, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres, se dedican a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, también laboran en la ciudad en distintas actividades.

Doña Luvina tiene 50 años, es casada y ha concebido 11 hijos, uno de ellos es casado e  independiente, uno trabaja y ayuda en la economía del hogar, seis de sus hijos trabajan aportan a la economía del hogar y están estudiando en el colegio por la noche y sus tres últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, su casa es propia.

La Señora. Luvina es comerciante ambulante, dedica a la venta de yogurt, queso y varios productos más como papas o lo que se encuentre de temporada y lleva 40 años en el negocio. En su casa cría ganado, cerdos y aves de corral.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 5 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir para compra de quesos, yogurt, papas, etc. para su negocio.
 
Su meta es aprender a conducir para comprarse un vehículo.
texts.en:
Luvina is a member of the 'Luz y Vida' (Light and Life) community bank.  She lives in Aguacate community, in the city of Cuenca.  The people here are very kind and have very warm hearts.  They maintain the culture and traditions of their parents and work in farming and livestock raising.  They also work in different activities in the city.

Luvina is 50 years old, married, and has conceived 11 children.  One of her children is married and independent, one works and helps with the household finances, six of her children work, contribute financially to the household and attend school in the evenings, and her three youngest children are attending  school in the city.  Luvina's husband farms and raises livestock.  They own their own home.

Luvina is a traveling saleswoman.  She sells yoghurt, cheese and several other products such as potatoes or whatever is in season.  She has been in this business for 40 years.  At home she raises cattle, pigs and farmyard birds.

Luvina has been a member of her community bank for five years and she will invest her new loan in buying cheese, yoghurt, potatoes, etc. for her business.  Her goal is to learn to drive and buy a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy cheese, yoghurt, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Tembelesia Shg Group

texts.en:
George is the facilitator of the Tembelesia SHG group. His group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
George takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, George had a good maize yield harvesting 8 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, George was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to George and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, George will educate his children. In 2012, the members of Tembelesia SHG group will each plant maize plots between half and 1 acre of land.
In the photograph above, George is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is from the village of Amasia in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with two children: a 14-year-old son and a 12-year-old daughter.  She is a trained nurse and has been engaged in farming for around 20 years.  She dreams for her children to attend and graduate from college.  Alla is looking for a loan to purchase livestock.  With this investment, her family income will increase by 20%.  The capital she has invested in her business is around four times her outstanding liabilities.  She enjoys living in Amasia and the ability to have access to financing.


About the Field Partner – AREGAK Universal Credit Organization

In the fall of 1997, United Methodist Committee on Relief (UMCOR) established the AREGAK microfinance program, with the purpose to create economic opportunities for low income people who have no or limited access to the formal financial sources, especially in the remote rural areas. The microfinance program rapidly became one of the largest MFI in Armenia in terms of number of active clients and portfolio size.
In March of 2006, AREGAK UCO was registered as a Universal Credit Organization, structured as a Closed Joint Stock Company with UMCOR as the sole shareholder.
Today, AREGAK UCO provides a broad range of financial services to the population without compromising the social aspects of its mission and continues initiatives geared toward the fulfillment of its ethical principles

Vision Statement

To be the most dynamic and ethical financial institution in Armenia and Nagorno Karabagh.

Mission Statement

AREGAK supports the economic development of small and medium entrepreneurs with high quality, accessible and reliable financial services.

AREGAK UCO’s Ethical Principles

1. Integrity and Excellence
We deliver on our promises
We are honest and transparent in everything we do
We provide excellent customer service

2. Respect and Inclusion
Our leadership, workforce and decision-making reflect and respect the diversity of customers and communities we serve. 
We value all employees, investing in their personal and professional growth. 

3. Innovation
We develop new processes and systems to improve efficiency
We create value added new products to enhance economic opportunities

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 59 years old,  married, and has six children, two of whom attend school. For the past six months, Ali has operated a retail shop, selling household staples to his neighbors and passersby. He also farms to earn additional income. 

Ali is requesting a loan for 40,000 KES, which he will use to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

Ali lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. He dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Mahougnon Denise

texts.fr: Mahougnon Denise est âgée de 33 ans et est mariée à un meunier du nom de Yves. Le couple a trois enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Mahougnon Denise vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Mahougnon Denise n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Mahougnon Denise mène comme activité depuis dix ans environs, la vente de condiments de sauce et divers autres articles (riz, maïs, etc.) à son domicile. C’est dans un marché du Bénin que Mahougnon Denise s’approvisionne. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Mahougnon Denise sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est d’accroître le niveau de son activité. Les trois  premiers crédits reçus antérieurement par Mahougnon Denise  ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Mahougnon Denise is 33 years old and married to a miller called Yves. The couple have 3 children in their care, some of whom are in school. Mahougnon Denise lives together with her husband and children, and the couple both take care of the household expenses.

Mahougnon Denise did not go to school. In order to be able to take care of her needs and those of her family, she has been selling condiments for sauce and other food products, like rice and corn, from her home for around 10 years. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin.

Mahougnon Denise is requesting a 4th loan from ALIDé so that she can restock on food products, strengthen her business and better respond to customer demand. Her goal is to increase her business. She has fully repaid her 3 previous loans.

loans.use: to buy sacs of corn and condiments.

loans.name: Anah

texts.en:
Anah is 35 years old and is married to Kasimbi. They have 3 children. She has been selling clothes for the past 5 years, earning a monthly income of Kes 8000.

She is requesting her first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 15,000. She will use the loan to purchase stock of clothes to sell in her open market stall. With the anticipated profits she will improve her family's living standards.

Her hopes and dreams are to open a major boutique outlet in her local trading centre

loans.use: To purchase stock of clothes

loans.name: Angelica Estefania

texts.es:
Angélica tiene 21 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pisco,  ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, posee lugares turísticos muy bellos como son “las Islas Ballestas” y el “Candelabro de Paracas”, asimismo playas hermosas y por ello es una ciudad muy visitada por los turistas en todo el año. Angélica es muy trabajadora, pero cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho jugar futbol con sus vecinos amigos de su barrio, pero también en ocasiones le gusta disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Ají de Gallina”.

Con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo entusiasmo Angélica trabaja en una empresa de pesca, especialmente realizando cortes de anchoveta, ella labora alrededor de 9 horas al día; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo por sus ganas de salir adelante.

Angélica está muy agradecida con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá  ladrillos, cemento, varillas de fierro, entre otros, con lo cual podrá realizar la construcción de una pared para poder cercar su vivienda, lo que le permitirá tener más seguridad para su familia, así ella podrá seguir trabajando con más tranquilidad y poder seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un negocio propio y poder terminar de construir su vivienda de material noble”.

loans.use: Para la compra de materiales de construccion

loans.name: Hector Ruben

texts.es:
Ruben es un hombre muy trabajador, vive al lado de su esposa y de su pequeño hijo de 8 años de edad, el cual es su adoración y por el cual lucha cada día para darle una buena calidad de vida, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Camana, ciudad que se caracteriza por sus hermosas playas, así como también por su agricultura, en especial el cultivo de arroz y también por los riquísimos camarones. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol con sus vecinos y amigos de su barrio, asimismo le gusta disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo Arroz chaufa.

Con mucho entusiasmo Ruben trabaja día a día en su negocio como maestro constructor, él le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 5 clientes de manera diaria, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y sobre todo tiene buenos acabados.

Ruben está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan su gran ayuda y gracias a ello gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar madera para su negocio, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia; así el podrá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y una buena calidad a su familia”.
texts.en:
Ruben is a very hardworking man. He lives with his wife and his 8 year old son, who he adores and for whom he struggles every day to provide a better quality of life. His house is in the city of Camana, known for beautiful beaches, agriculture (particularly rice), and also for their delicious shrimp. When he has free time he likes to play soccer with his neighbors and friends who live close by. He also likes to enjoy one of his favorite dishes, fried rice. 

Ruben works enthusiastically every day in his job as a construction master. He works 10 hours a day and can attend to up to 5 customers in a day. He believes that his business is going well because he's very responsible and above all because he provides a good finished product. 

Ruben is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since this is the second time they have given him their help. Thanks to them, he will be able to buy wood for his business, which will allow him to increase his income and give his family a better quality of life. He will also be able to keep fighting to realize his greatest dream: "Giving his son a good education and his family a good quality of life."

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Paulina; La socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de ganado, la socia a la vez continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir trabajando para su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de arroz, gaseosas entre otros. 
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This lady is a member of the communal bank “Santa Rosita de Ayllupampa,” located in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco Department.

Her name is Paulina. She is still buying and selling cattle and at the same time has a grocery store. She has had it for a while and does well thanks to her hard work. She would like to continue working in order to provide for her family.

Paulina requested a loan to buy rice and sodas, among other things. She appreciates the loan she received and promises to pay the installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy rice and sodas, among other things.

loans.name: Jesusdjro Group

texts.fr: JESUSDJRO est un groupe composé de cinq personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Madeleine Missinmahou (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 45 ans n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Madeleine Missinmahou est mariée à un certain Pierre. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Madeleine Missinmahou et son mari. Pour cette raison, Madeleine Missinmahou prépare de la nourriture qu'elle revend à son domicile depuis quatre ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Madeleine Missinmahou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Madeleine Missinmahou sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe JESUSDJRO, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des condiments, du maïs et des poissons.

loans.name: Jena Ruth

texts.en:
Her name is Jena Ruth, 38 years old, a good standing member of CCT, Dasmarinas, Cavite for four years. Married to Jumas, an employee and has one child who is still in the elementary Level in School. No matter how hard life is, the couple do is inspired to work hard to give their only child the best education to allow her a better future.

Her direct selling of beauty and skin, and cleaning agents, underwear and other personal products of popular brands has earned her not only friends but extra money for her family's daily personal needs. To help her sustain her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan meet the increasing orders of face and body lotion, whitening products, shampoo, and other household cleaning agents. Your assistance will be a great help to sustain her business. 

Jena Ruth aims not only to continue her direct selling but is thinking of putting up a printing service in the future to adequately support her child's higher education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital,and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for beauty and skin products like body and skin lotion, cologne, make ups, deodorants, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Aura

texts.en:
My name is Aura M.. I prepare and sell tortillas. I have had my business for 4 years and I have several clients in my area, including neighbours and business like mini markets and small stores to which I sell my tortillas packed daily. These sales help me support my family. My goal is to increase my inventory and increase my sales, and to give the opportunity to other women to help me. With the profit I would be able to support my family and give them a good education.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Aura M. me dedico a la producción de tortillas, tengo mi negocio hace 4 años en donde tengo muchos clientes de mi localidad, negocios y vecinos como ser mercaditos y pulperías las que les vendo mis tortillas empacadas a diario, dichas ventas me ayudan a mantener a mi familia y me gustaría tener mayores ventas, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario y tener mayores ventas pero para eso tendría que darle la oportunidad a otras mujeres para que me ayuden, y con las ganancias que obtenga poder mantener a mi familia y darles su educación.

loans.use: To buy corn flour, salt, lime, water, wood, matches, coal.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela Akeyo O. is 34 years old. She is married and has four children. They live within the Kibera slums of Nairobi. She also takes care of six orphans left behind by her brother who passed away in 2000 due to HIV/AIDS.

Initially, Pamela was employed at a salon where she was paid by commission for the work done.  However, the pay was little. She persevered because she had a large family looking up to her. Pamela saved some money from the two years she was employed, which she used to buy a second-hand blowdryer and dryer. Afterwards, through a village merry-go-round group for women, Pamela received Ksh 2,000 (USD 28) which she used to purchase combs, towels and a sink.

In 2003, Pamela started her own salon. Due to her skill in hairdressing, including braiding, weaving, perming (chemical application for hair straightening) and styling, the demand for her services has increased. She is therefore requesting a loan of USD 100 to enable her buy an additional blowdryer, four big chairs and two small chairs for the children. 

Because her clientele has increased, she wants them to be comfortable while waiting to be served. This means her clients who used to go to the neighboring salons because they got tired of waiting will now be served quickly. The outcome of this will be higher income. 

Through this, Pamela will be able to better support her family. The repayment period for her loan is between 8 and 15 months.

loans.use: to purchase a blowdryer and six chairs

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo P. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  Her husband is a commune officer and makes about $4 per day.  P. rents out rooms from her house to factory workers living in the area.  She makes about $2 a day from this business activity.  Two of the couple's three children are still in school, while the third works at a garment factory.  They hope to use this loan to repair their house so that they can increase the rent that they charge to their tenants.  In the future, the couple would like to build another house which they would use exclusively as a rental property.  P. also hopes that her children will be able to finish high school.

loans.use: To repair a house for rental purposes

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 51 years old and is married to Nestor A.. She makes traditional Paraguayan blankets, throws, and bedspreads. She works from her house on a hand-built loom that she has outside of her house.

Besides weaving, she also has a despensa, a small grocery store, at her house. She started her despensa about a year ago. Julia has three children, ages 28, 22, and 20, whom help her out with her store. All of her children finished studying technology but are unemployed right now and are only working on small informal jobs.

For more than 10 years, Julia has been traveling every 15 days with her husband, and at times by herself, on a two hour bus ride to Asuncion to sell her merchandise. She has about 20 clients in Asuncion that she sells to. She does not sell to stores, but rather sells house to house directly to her customers.

She also practices a common method of payment whereby a client requests and receives the order, and they pay Julia in small amounts every 15 days when she returns to Asuncion until they finish paying off the money they owe her.

Julia and Nestor have been working with Fundacion Paraguaya for many years now. They are an excellent client and very thankful for being able to take loans out from the Foundation. They are currently seeking a loan to purchase craft thread to complete more orders and to expand their business.

loans.use: Purchase craft thread.

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en:
Mr. Nizami is a vulnerable, low income person.  He is 52, married with two children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Nizami has run his business since early childhood when he helped his father to graze the family herd.  After he married and lived separately, Nizami started his own business with two cows given to him as a gift by his father.  Today his number of milk producing cows has risen to 12.  

Nizami sells 120 litres of milk daily in Saatli town, but he sees that he can provide more customers with milk.  To do this he has to increase the number of milk cows in his herd.  That’s why Nizami has applied to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for a $500 loan to buy one more pure-bred cow to make his monthly income higher.  This amount isn't enough to cover all of his purchasing expenditures because the price of one calf in the Caucasus region is about $80-100 and Nizami plans to buy ten calves.  He has some money of his own to add to cover all his expenditures.

loans.use: To buy a pedigree cow

loans.name: Francisca Maria Luci

texts.pt:
Francisca is a married mother of 7. Francisca’s husband is a self-employed carpenter. He has a small carpentry shop. She entered the loan program in 2006. She would like to use the money to invest in the business. She entered the program to help her husband support the children. All of the children attend school. The husband’s earnings from the shop are meager, forcing her to somehow help cover the household expenses. She is now in her fourth cycle. She would like to expand her business by selling school bags. If all goes well, she plans to help her husband renovate their home.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisca e casad e mae de 7 filhos. O marido de Francisco e carpinteiro por conta propria. Tem uma pequena oficina de carpintaria. Ela entrou para o programa de credito em 2006.Ela quer usar o dinheiro para investir no negocio. Ela entrou parao programa para poder ajudar o marido a sustentar os filhos. Todos os filhos estao a estudar o marido nao tem grandes rendimentos na oficina por isso ela tinha que fazer alguma coisa para ajudar nas despesas da casa.Ela esta agora no quarto ciclo. Ela quer introduzir no seu negocio a venda de pastas escolares como forma de ampliar o seu negocio. Se tudo correr bem ela pensa ajudar o marido na reabilitacao da casa onde vivem.

loans.use: Francisca would like to use the money to buy more bundles of used clothing for the business

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 33 year old father of 3 who ives with his family in the Bekaa region of Lebanon. Hussein is a butcher and supports his entire family with the income earned from his butcher store business. This is the second time Hussein is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua. He needs the loan to buy provisions for his business. Hussein is an honest and hardworking man and can be relied upon to repay his loan.

loans.use: To buy provisions for his butcher shop

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 27 year-old Asha K.. She is married with three children, aged 1, 7, and 10. In 2005 Asha established a grocery business, and now requires a loan of $175 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Asha would like to purchase additional stock in bulk for her grocery business.

loans.name: Shodibek

texts.ru:
Shodibek J. lives in the Gissar region. He is 36 years old, is married, and has 3 children. He has a high school education. Shodibek is in the business of animal sales. For this reason, he plans to use the loan to purchase several young bulls. He generally buys animals on the market at a low price and then resells them at the same market at a higher price. This business gives him an opportunity to make money and provide for his family. Aside from that, his business also contributes to development of farming businesses in the area.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Джаборов Шодибек проживает в районе Гиссар. 36 лет, женат имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Клиент занимается торговлей крупно-рогатого скота. поэтому клиент планирует получить кредит для того чтобы приобрести бычков. Приобретает товар клиент на рынке по более дешевой цене, а реализует там же , по более выгодной. Эта деятельность дает возможность зарабатывать деньги и обеспечивать семью. Кроме того это дает возможность развитию сельскохозяйственного сектора.

loans.use: To purchase several young bulls

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
Saturnina is requesting a loan of 2000 soles. She will invest these funds in buying sugar, rice, beer, legumes and potatoes. Saturnina has been part of the Community Bank “Llapanchik” - which means “Everyone” in the indigenous language of Quechua for 8 years. Through the bank she learned how to run her business, guide her children, to be responsible and punctual.

Saturnina is 49 years old, mother of 6. She has a small store where she sells legumes, meats and other items. Saturnina started by selling drinks but diversified when she noticed sales increasing. With her savings she plans on paying for the schooling of her children. Her dreams are to generate more capital for her business and see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

Saturnina es socia del Banco Comunal “Llapanchik” que significa “Todos” en quechua hace 8 años. En su Banco Comunal le enseñaron a como administrar su negocio, orientar a los hijos, ser puntual y responsable.

Saturnina es casada, tiene 49 años y 6 hijos, Saturnina tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carnes, Saturnina cuenta que al inicio solo vendía bebidas y al notar que había demanda decidió surtir su negocio.

Saturnina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, cerveza, verduras y papa.

Sus ahorros lo utilizará en la educación de sus hijo que ingresará a la universidad y para incrementar el capital de sus negocios. Los sueños de Saturnina son tener más capital para surtir mas su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Saturnina is requesting a loan of 2000 soles. She will invest these funds in buying sugar, rice, beer, legumes and potatoes.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia U. sells clothes and tailoring materials.She has been in this business for the past 6 years. She lives in Iyanuera in Lagos State, Nigeria.She is 27 years of age with 2 children, and has being borrowing from LAPO microfinance for the past 2 years.

Felicia needs a loan of $875 to enable her buy more clothes and tailoring material in order to expand her business. She is thankful to Kiva for this opportunity. This can be seen from the broad smile in her face throughout our interview.

loans.use: To buy more cloths and tailoring materials.

loans.name: Phuon

texts.en: Mrs. Phuon N. is a 43 year-old woman who lives with her husband and their four children in Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. She makes a living by growing and selling vegetables and can earn approximately $2.60 per day. Her husband is a 44 year-old veterinarian who can earn up to $3.00 a day. Phuon N. requests a $800 loan to purchase a motorbike to help in her business, as well as to purchase pigs to raise.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her business and additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mr. Thy S. (photographed with the duck’s feed behind him), 51, and his wife, Mrs. Kan Chea, 51, live in a Phnom Penh suburb. They were married in 1981 and have one son and two daughters. Two of their children are married and raise ducks, and the youngest daughter is a garment factory worker.

Mr. Thy and his wife have been in the business of raising ducks since 1990. Currently, they are raising 550 ducks at the farm near the house. They sell the duck eggs at a market not very far from their home. He is requesting a loan of US$600 to purchase feed for raising ducks.

loans.use: To purchase feed for raising ducks.

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati F., 43, is married with 6 children. She has many years of experience in the vegetable business. She sells to relatives and the village community and also to friends 3 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).

SPBD loans are Fati’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will assist her in operating her business. Her husband is always the backbone of her project.

loans.use: Purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizer and spade, bush knives

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 45 years,She is a married woman with 3 children ages ranging 25 and 21.She became a fish seller in 2003. Every day, she works from 6am to 2pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Halima now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Née à Tabligbo en 1982, monsieur S. est marié et père d’un enfant. C’est un commerçant d’huile à moteur très rusé.
